plotOptions-solidgauge-tooltip--shape.description: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the tooltip. In Highcharts 3.x and less, the shape was square.

plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--defer.name: plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--defer
plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--defer.title: defer
plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--defer.description: Whether to defer displaying the data labels until the initial series animation has finished.

plotOptions-line-dataLabels--zIndex.name: plotOptions-line-dataLabels--zIndex
plotOptions-line-dataLabels--zIndex.title: zIndex
plotOptions-line-dataLabels--zIndex.description: The Z index of the data labels. The default Z index puts it above the series. Use a Z index of 2 to display it behind the series.

plotOptions-areaspline-states-hover-mark.name: plotOptions-areaspline-states-hover-marker--fillColor
plotOptions-areaspline-states-hover-mark.title: fillColor
plotOptions-areaspline-states-hover-mark.description: The fill color of the point marker. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

plotOptions-area--enableMouseTracking.name: plotOptions-area--enableMouseTracking
plotOptions-area--enableMouseTracking.title: enableMouseTracking
plotOptions-area--enableMouseTracking.description: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance.

plotOptions-areaspline--connectEnds.name: plotOptions-areaspline--connectEnds
plotOptions-areaspline--connectEnds.title: connectEnds
plotOptions-areaspline--connectEnds.description: Polar charts only. Whether to connect the ends of a line series plot across the extremes.

plotOptions-spline-dataLabels--shape.name: plotOptions-spline-dataLabels--shape
plotOptions-spline-dataLabels--shape.title: shape
plotOptions-spline-dataLabels--shape.description: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the label. Symbols are predefined functions on the Renderer object.

plotOptions-gauge-pivot--borderWidth.name: plotOptions-gauge-pivot--borderWidth
plotOptions-gauge-pivot--borderWidth.title: borderWidth
plotOptions-gauge-pivot--borderWidth.description: The border or stroke width of the pivot.

plotOptions-polygon-marker--enabled.name: plotOptions-polygon-marker--enabled
plotOptions-polygon-marker--enabled.title: enabled
plotOptions-polygon-marker--enabled.description: Enable or disable the point marker.

plotOptions-pyramid--slicedOffset.name: plotOptions-pyramid--slicedOffset
plotOptions-pyramid--slicedOffset.title: slicedOffset
plotOptions-pyramid--slicedOffset.description: If a point is sliced, moved out from the center, how many pixels should  it be moved?.

plotOptions-area-tooltip--valueDecimals.name: plotOptions-area-tooltip--valueDecimals
plotOptions-area-tooltip--valueDecimals.title: valueDecimals
plotOptions-area-tooltip--valueDecimals.description: How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.

plotOptions-pyramid--width.name: plotOptions-pyramid--width
plotOptions-pyramid--width.title: width
plotOptions-pyramid--width.description: The width of the funnel compared to the width of the plot area, or the pixel width if it is a number.

plotOptions-solidgauge-zones--value.name: plotOptions-solidgauge-zones--value
plotOptions-solidgauge-zones--value.title: value
plotOptions-solidgauge-zones--value.description: The value up to where the zone extends, if undefined the zones stretches to the last value in the series.

plotOptions-pie-states-hover-marker--lin.name: plotOptions-pie-states-hover-marker--lineColor
plotOptions-pie-states-hover-marker--lin.title: lineColor
plotOptions-pie-states-hover-marker--lin.description: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

plotOptions-solidgauge--cursor.name: plotOptions-solidgauge--cursor
plotOptions-solidgauge--cursor.title: cursor
plotOptions-solidgauge--cursor.description: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to  the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked.

plotOptions-scatter-states-hover-marker-.name: plotOptions-scatter-states-hover-marker--width
plotOptions-scatter-states-hover-marker-.title: width
plotOptions-scatter-states-hover-marker-.description: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a height must also be set.

plotOptions-errorbar-states-hover-halo--.name: plotOptions-errorbar-states-hover-halo--opacity
plotOptions-errorbar-states-hover-halo--.title: opacity
plotOptions-errorbar-states-hover-halo--.description: Opacity for the halo unless a specific fill is overridden using the attributes setting. Note that Highcharts is only able to apply opacity to colors of hex or rgb(a) formats.

plotOptions-line-tooltip--footerFormat.name: plotOptions-line-tooltip--footerFormat
plotOptions-line-tooltip--footerFormat.title: footerFormat
plotOptions-line-tooltip--footerFormat.description: A string to append to the tooltip format.

plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--crop.name: plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--crop
plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--crop.title: crop
plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--crop.description: Whether to hide data labels that are outside the plot area. By default, the data label is moved inside the plot area according to the overflow option.

plotOptions-columnrange-dataLabels--xHig.name: plotOptions-columnrange-dataLabels--xHigh
plotOptions-columnrange-dataLabels--xHig.title: xHigh
plotOptions-columnrange-dataLabels--xHig.description: X offset of the higher data labels relative to the point value.

plotOptions-spline-tooltip--footerFormat.name: plotOptions-spline-tooltip--footerFormat
plotOptions-spline-tooltip--footerFormat.title: footerFormat
plotOptions-spline-tooltip--footerFormat.description: A string to append to the tooltip format.

plotOptions-polygon-marker--symbol.name: plotOptions-polygon-marker--symbol
plotOptions-polygon-marker--symbol.title: symbol
plotOptions-polygon-marker--symbol.description:
A predefined shape or symbol for the marker. When null, the symbol is pulled from options.symbols. Other possible values are "circle", "square", "diamond", "triangle" and "triangle-down".

Additionally, the URL to a graphic can be given on this form: "url(graphic.png)". Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.

Custom callbacks for symbol path generation can also be added to Highcharts.SVGRenderer.prototype.symbols. The callback is then used by its method name, as shown in the demo.

plotOptions-areaspline-tooltip--valuePre.name: plotOptions-areaspline-tooltip--valuePrefix
plotOptions-areaspline-tooltip--valuePre.title: valuePrefix
plotOptions-areaspline-tooltip--valuePre.description: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover--lineWidth
plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover.title: lineWidth
plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover.description: Pixel with of the graph line.

exporting--enabled.name: exporting--enabled
exporting--enabled.title: enabled
exporting--enabled.description: Whether to enable the exporting module. Disabling the module will hide the context button, but API methods will still be available.

lang--resetZoom.name: lang--resetZoom
lang--resetZoom.title: resetZoom
lang--resetZoom.description: The text for the label appearing when a chart is zoomed.

plotOptions-bubble-states-hover-halo--at.name: plotOptions-bubble-states-hover-halo--attributes
plotOptions-bubble-states-hover-halo--at.title: attributes
plotOptions-bubble-states-hover-halo--at.description: A collection of SVG attributes to override the appearance of the halo, for example fill, stroke and stroke-width.

plotOptions-areasplinerange--negativeCol.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange--negativeColor
plotOptions-areasplinerange--negativeCol.title: negativeColor
plotOptions-areasplinerange--negativeCol.description: The color for the parts of the graph or points that are below the threshold.

data--firstRowAsNames.name: data--firstRowAsNames
data--firstRowAsNames.title: firstRowAsNames
data--firstRowAsNames.description: Whether to use the first row in the data set as series names.

plotOptions-area--negativeColor.name: plotOptions-area--negativeColor
plotOptions-area--negativeColor.title: negativeColor
plotOptions-area--negativeColor.description: The color for the parts of the graph or points that are below the threshold.

plotOptions-column--allowPointSelect.name: plotOptions-column--allowPointSelect
plotOptions-column--allowPointSelect.title: allowPointSelect
plotOptions-column--allowPointSelect.description: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices.

plotOptions-column--borderColor.name: plotOptions-column--borderColor
plotOptions-column--borderColor.title: borderColor
plotOptions-column--borderColor.description: The color of the border surrounding each column or bar.

plotOptions-column--turboThreshold.name: plotOptions-column--turboThreshold
plotOptions-column--turboThreshold.title: turboThreshold
plotOptions-column--turboThreshold.description: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Set it to 0 disable.

plotOptions-polygon-states-hover-marker-.name: plotOptions-polygon-states-hover-marker--radius
plotOptions-polygon-states-hover-marker-.title: radius
plotOptions-polygon-states-hover-marker-.description: The radius of the point marker.

plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--backgr.name: plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--backgroundColor
plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--backgr.title: backgroundColor
plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--backgr.description: The background color or gradient for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

plotOptions-areaspline-marker-states-sel.name: plotOptions-areaspline-marker-states-select--enabled
plotOptions-areaspline-marker-states-sel.title: enabled
plotOptions-areaspline-marker-states-sel.description: Enable or disable visible feedback for selection.

plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--shape.name: plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--shape
plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--shape.title: shape
plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--shape.description: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the label. Symbols are predefined functions on the Renderer object.

plotOptions-columnrange--groupPadding.name: plotOptions-columnrange--groupPadding
plotOptions-columnrange--groupPadding.title: groupPadding
plotOptions-columnrange--groupPadding.description: Padding between each value groups, in x axis units.

plotOptions-pie--size.name: plotOptions-pie--size
plotOptions-pie--size.title: size
plotOptions-pie--size.description: The diameter of the pie relative to the plot area. Can be a percentage or pixel value. Pixel values are given as integers. The default behaviour (as of 3.0) is to scale to the plot area and give room for data labels within the plot area. As a consequence, the size of the pie may vary when points are updated and data labels more around. In that case it is best to set a fixed value, for example "75%".

plotOptions-waterfall--depth.name: plotOptions-waterfall--depth
plotOptions-waterfall--depth.title: depth
plotOptions-waterfall--depth.description: Depth of the columns in a 3D column chart. Requires highcharts-3d.js.

plotOptions-errorbar--whiskerWidth.name: plotOptions-errorbar--whiskerWidth
plotOptions-errorbar--whiskerWidth.title: whiskerWidth
plotOptions-errorbar--whiskerWidth.description: The line width of the whiskers, the horizontal lines marking low and high values. When null, the general lineWidth applies.

plotOptions-scatter--pointStart.name: plotOptions-scatter--pointStart
plotOptions-scatter--pointStart.title: pointStart
plotOptions-scatter--pointStart.description: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945.

plotOptions-area-marker--lineColor.name: plotOptions-area-marker--lineColor
plotOptions-area-marker--lineColor.title: lineColor
plotOptions-area-marker--lineColor.description: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

plotOptions-bar-states-hover-marker--lin.name: plotOptions-bar-states-hover-marker--lineWidth
plotOptions-bar-states-hover-marker--lin.title: lineWidth
plotOptions-bar-states-hover-marker--lin.description: The width of the point marker's outline.

plotOptions-area-zones--color.name: plotOptions-area-zones--color
plotOptions-area-zones--color.title: color
plotOptions-area-zones--color.description: Defines the color of the series.

plotOptions-line-states-hover-marker--li.name: plotOptions-line-states-hover-marker--lineColor
plotOptions-line-states-hover-marker--li.title: lineColor
plotOptions-line-states-hover-marker--li.description: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

chart-options3d--enabled.name: chart-options3d--enabled
chart-options3d--enabled.title: enabled
chart-options3d--enabled.description: Wether to render the chart using the 3D functionality.

plotOptions-line-dataLabels--allowOverla.name: plotOptions-line-dataLabels--allowOverlap
plotOptions-line-dataLabels--allowOverla.title: allowOverlap
plotOptions-line-dataLabels--allowOverla.description: Whether to allow data labels to overlap. To make the labels less sensitive for overlapping, the dataLabels.padding can be set to 0.

plotOptions-funnel--slicedOffset.name: plotOptions-funnel--slicedOffset
plotOptions-funnel--slicedOffset.title: slicedOffset
plotOptions-funnel--slicedOffset.description: If a point is sliced, moved out from the center, how many pixels should  it be moved?.

plotOptions-areasplinerange--pointPlacem.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange--pointPlacement
plotOptions-areasplinerange--pointPlacem.title: pointPlacement
plotOptions-areasplinerange--pointPlacem.description:
Possible values: null, "on", "between".

In a column chart, when pointPlacement is "on", the point will not create any padding of the X axis. In a polar column chart this means that the first column points directly north. If the pointPlacement is "between", the columns will be laid out between ticks. This is useful for example for visualising an amount between two points in time or in a certain sector of a polar chart.

Since Highcharts 3.0.2, the point placement can also be numeric, where 0 is on the axis value, -0.5 is between this value and the previous, and 0.5 is between this value and the next. Unlike the textual options, numeric point placement options won't affect axis padding.

Defaults to null in cartesian charts, "between" in polar charts.

plotOptions-pyramid--allowPointSelect.name: plotOptions-pyramid--allowPointSelect
plotOptions-pyramid--allowPointSelect.title: allowPointSelect
plotOptions-pyramid--allowPointSelect.description: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices.

plotOptions-line--pointInterval.name: plotOptions-line--pointInterval
plotOptions-line--pointInterval.title: pointInterval
plotOptions-line--pointInterval.description:
If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointInterval defines the interval of the x values. For example, if a series contains one value every decade starting from year 0, set pointInterval to 10.

Since Highcharts 4.1, it can be combined with pointIntervalUnit to draw irregular intervals.

plotOptions-heatmap-dataLabels--align.name: plotOptions-heatmap-dataLabels--align
plotOptions-heatmap-dataLabels--align.title: align
plotOptions-heatmap-dataLabels--align.description: The alignment of the data label compared to the point. If right, the right side of the label should be touching the point. For points with an extent, like columns, the alignments also dictates how to align it inside the box, as given with the inside option. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right".

plotOptions-waterfall-dataLabels--border.name: plotOptions-waterfall-dataLabels--borderColor
plotOptions-waterfall-dataLabels--border.title: borderColor
plotOptions-waterfall-dataLabels--border.description: The border color for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

plotOptions-treemap-levels--dataLabels.name: plotOptions-treemap-levels--dataLabels
plotOptions-treemap-levels--dataLabels.title: dataLabels
plotOptions-treemap-levels--dataLabels.description: Can set the options of dataLabels on each point which lies on the level. plotOptions.treemap.dataLabels for possible values.

plotOptions-arearange-states-hover-marke.name: plotOptions-arearange-states-hover-marker--width
plotOptions-arearange-states-hover-marke.title: width
plotOptions-arearange-states-hover-marke.description: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a height must also be set.

plotOptions-waterfall-tooltip--pointForm.name: plotOptions-waterfall-tooltip--pointFormat
plotOptions-waterfall-tooltip--pointForm.title: pointFormat
plotOptions-waterfall-tooltip--pointForm.description: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.yPrefix and tooltip.ySuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units.

plotOptions-line-zones--color.name: plotOptions-line-zones--color
plotOptions-line-zones--color.title: color
plotOptions-line-zones--color.description: Defines the color of the series.

plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--borderRa.name: plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--borderRadius
plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--borderRa.title: borderRadius
plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--borderRa.description: The border radius in pixels for the data label.

plotOptions-bubble-tooltip--pointFormat.name: plotOptions-bubble-tooltip--pointFormat
plotOptions-bubble-tooltip--pointFormat.title: pointFormat
plotOptions-bubble-tooltip--pointFormat.description: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.yPrefix and tooltip.ySuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units.

plotOptions-treemap-states-hover-marker-.name: plotOptions-treemap-states-hover-marker--symbol
plotOptions-treemap-states-hover-marker-.title: symbol
plotOptions-treemap-states-hover-marker-.description:
A predefined shape or symbol for the marker. When null, the symbol is pulled from options.symbols. Other possible values are "circle", "square", "diamond", "triangle" and "triangle-down".

Additionally, the URL to a graphic can be given on this form: "url(graphic.png)". Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.

Custom callbacks for symbol path generation can also be added to Highcharts.SVGRenderer.prototype.symbols. The callback is then used by its method name, as shown in the demo.

data--parsed.name: data--parsed
data--parsed.title: parsed
data--parsed.description: A callback function to access the parsed columns, the two-dimentional input data array directly, before they are interpreted into series data and categories. Return false to stop completion, or call this.complete() to continue async.

plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--sha.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--shape
plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--sha.title: shape
plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--sha.description: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the tooltip. In Highcharts 3.x and less, the shape was square.

plotOptions-areaspline--threshold.name: plotOptions-areaspline--threshold
plotOptions-areaspline--threshold.title: threshold
plotOptions-areaspline--threshold.description: The Y axis value to serve as the base for the area, for distinguishing between values above and below a threshold. If null, the area behaves like a line series with fill between the graph and the Y axis minimum.

plotOptions-column-dataLabels--shadow.name: plotOptions-column-dataLabels--shadow
plotOptions-column-dataLabels--shadow.title: shadow
plotOptions-column-dataLabels--shadow.description: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

plotOptions-column-tooltip--footerFormat.name: plotOptions-column-tooltip--footerFormat
plotOptions-column-tooltip--footerFormat.title: footerFormat
plotOptions-column-tooltip--footerFormat.description: A string to append to the tooltip format.

plotOptions-column--groupPadding.name: plotOptions-column--groupPadding
plotOptions-column--groupPadding.title: groupPadding
plotOptions-column--groupPadding.description: Padding between each value groups, in x axis units.

plotOptions-gauge-dial--borderColor.name: plotOptions-gauge-dial--borderColor
plotOptions-gauge-dial--borderColor.title: borderColor
plotOptions-gauge-dial--borderColor.description: The border color or stroke of the gauge's dial. By default, the borderWidth is 0, so this must be set in addition to a custom border color.

plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--inside.name: plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--inside
plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--inside.title: inside
plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--inside.description: For points with an extent, like columns, whether to align the data label inside the box or to the actual value point. Defaults to false in most cases, true in stacked columns.

plotOptions-column-tooltip--xDateFormat.name: plotOptions-column-tooltip--xDateFormat
plotOptions-column-tooltip--xDateFormat.title: xDateFormat
plotOptions-column-tooltip--xDateFormat.description: The format for the date in the tooltip header if the X axis is a datetime axis. The default is a best guess based on the smallest distance between points in the chart.

plotOptions-boxplot--stemDashStyle.name: plotOptions-boxplot--stemDashStyle
plotOptions-boxplot--stemDashStyle.title: stemDashStyle
plotOptions-boxplot--stemDashStyle.description: The dash style of the stem, the vertical line extending from the box to the whiskers.

plotOptions-column-dataLabels--borderRad.name: plotOptions-column-dataLabels--borderRadius
plotOptions-column-dataLabels--borderRad.title: borderRadius
plotOptions-column-dataLabels--borderRad.description: The border radius in pixels for the data label.

plotOptions-bubble--zoneAxis.name: plotOptions-bubble--zoneAxis
plotOptions-bubble--zoneAxis.title: zoneAxis
plotOptions-bubble--zoneAxis.description: Defines the Axis on which the zones are applied.

plotOptions-column-tooltip--hideDelay.name: plotOptions-column-tooltip--hideDelay
plotOptions-column-tooltip--hideDelay.title: hideDelay
plotOptions-column-tooltip--hideDelay.description: The number of milliseconds to wait until the tooltip is hidden when mouse out from a point or chart.

plotOptions-scatter-marker--width.name: plotOptions-scatter-marker--width
plotOptions-scatter-marker--width.title: width
plotOptions-scatter-marker--width.description: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a height must also be set.

yAxis--minorTickInterval.name: yAxis--minorTickInterval
yAxis--minorTickInterval.title: minorTickInterval
yAxis--minorTickInterval.description:
Tick interval in scale units for the minor ticks. On a linear axis, if "auto", the minor tick interval is calculated as a fifth of the tickInterval. If null, minor ticks are not shown.

On logarithmic axes, the unit is the power of the value. For example, setting the minorTickInterval to 1 puts one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. Setting the minorTickInterval to 0.1 produces 9 ticks between 1 and 10, 10 and 100 etc. A minorTickInterval of "auto" on a log axis results in a best guess, attempting to enter approximately 5 minor ticks between each major tick.

If user settings dictate minor ticks to become too dense, they don't make sense, and will be ignored to prevent performance problems.

On axes using categories, minor ticks are not supported.

plotOptions-waterfall--animation.name: plotOptions-waterfall--animation
plotOptions-waterfall--animation.title: animation
plotOptions-waterfall--animation.description:
Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. The animation can also be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods. The following properties are supported:

duration
The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
easing
When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooTools as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing.

Due to poor performance, animation is disabled in old IE browsers for column charts and polar charts.

plotOptions-columnrange--edgeWidth.name: plotOptions-columnrange--edgeWidth
plotOptions-columnrange--edgeWidth.title: edgeWidth
plotOptions-columnrange--edgeWidth.description: 3D columns only. The width of the colored edges.

plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover--lineWidthPlus
plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover.title: lineWidthPlus
plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover.description: The additional line width for the graph of a hovered series.

plotOptions-spline-marker--symbol.name: plotOptions-spline-marker--symbol
plotOptions-spline-marker--symbol.title: symbol
plotOptions-spline-marker--symbol.description:
A predefined shape or symbol for the marker. When null, the symbol is pulled from options.symbols. Other possible values are "circle", "square", "diamond", "triangle" and "triangle-down".

Additionally, the URL to a graphic can be given on this form: "url(graphic.png)". Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.

Custom callbacks for symbol path generation can also be added to Highcharts.SVGRenderer.prototype.symbols. The callback is then used by its method name, as shown in the demo.

plotOptions-pyramid-tooltip--followTouch.name: plotOptions-pyramid-tooltip--followTouchMove
plotOptions-pyramid-tooltip--followTouch.title: followTouchMove
plotOptions-pyramid-tooltip--followTouch.description: Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove.

plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--borderRadius
plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--.title: borderRadius
plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--.description: The border radius in pixels for the data label.

plotOptions-treemap-states-hover-marker-.name: plotOptions-treemap-states-hover-marker--lineWidth
plotOptions-treemap-states-hover-marker-.title: lineWidth
plotOptions-treemap-states-hover-marker-.description: The width of the point marker's outline.

plotOptions-spline-states-hover-halo--op.name: plotOptions-spline-states-hover-halo--opacity
plotOptions-spline-states-hover-halo--op.title: opacity
plotOptions-spline-states-hover-halo--op.description: Opacity for the halo unless a specific fill is overridden using the attributes setting. Note that Highcharts is only able to apply opacity to colors of hex or rgb(a) formats.

plotOptions-areaspline--pointPlacement.name: plotOptions-areaspline--pointPlacement
plotOptions-areaspline--pointPlacement.title: pointPlacement
plotOptions-areaspline--pointPlacement.description:
Possible values: null, "on", "between".

In a column chart, when pointPlacement is "on", the point will not create any padding of the X axis. In a polar column chart this means that the first column points directly north. If the pointPlacement is "between", the columns will be laid out between ticks. This is useful for example for visualising an amount between two points in time or in a certain sector of a polar chart.

Since Highcharts 3.0.2, the point placement can also be numeric, where 0 is on the axis value, -0.5 is between this value and the previous, and 0.5 is between this value and the next. Unlike the textual options, numeric point placement options won't affect axis padding.

Defaults to null in cartesian charts, "between" in polar charts.

plotOptions-funnel--width.name: plotOptions-funnel--width
plotOptions-funnel--width.title: width
plotOptions-funnel--width.description: The width of the funnel compared to the width of the plot area, or the pixel width if it is a number.

data--switchRowsAndColumns.name: data--switchRowsAndColumns
data--switchRowsAndColumns.title: switchRowsAndColumns
data--switchRowsAndColumns.description: Switch rows and columns of the input data, so that this.columns effectively becomes the rows of the data set, and the rows are interpreted as series.

plotOptions-bubble--zMax.name: plotOptions-bubble--zMax
plotOptions-bubble--zMax.title: zMax
plotOptions-bubble--zMax.description: The minimum for the Z value range. Defaults to the highest Z value in the data.

plotOptions-waterfall-states-hover--enab.name: plotOptions-waterfall-states-hover--enabled
plotOptions-waterfall-states-hover--enab.title: enabled
plotOptions-waterfall-states-hover--enab.description: Enable separate styles for the hovered series to visualize that the user hovers either the series itself or the legend.			.

plotOptions-spline-marker-states-select-.name: plotOptions-spline-marker-states-select--radius
plotOptions-spline-marker-states-select-.title: radius
plotOptions-spline-marker-states-select-.description:
The radius of the point marker. In hover state, it defaults
		to the normal state's radius + 2.

plotOptions-areaspline--visible.name: plotOptions-areaspline--visible
plotOptions-areaspline--visible.title: visible
plotOptions-areaspline--visible.description: Set the initial visibility of the series.

plotOptions-spline-marker-states-hover--.name: plotOptions-spline-marker-states-hover--enabled
plotOptions-spline-marker-states-hover--.title: enabled
plotOptions-spline-marker-states-hover--.description: Enable or disable the point marker.

plotOptions-boxplot--grouping.name: plotOptions-boxplot--grouping
plotOptions-boxplot--grouping.title: grouping
plotOptions-boxplot--grouping.description: Whether to group non-stacked columns or to let them render independent of each other. Non-grouped columns will be laid out individually and overlap each other.

plotOptions-heatmap-states-hover-halo--o.name: plotOptions-heatmap-states-hover-halo--opacity
plotOptions-heatmap-states-hover-halo--o.title: opacity
plotOptions-heatmap-states-hover-halo--o.description: Opacity for the halo unless a specific fill is overridden using the attributes setting. Note that Highcharts is only able to apply opacity to colors of hex or rgb(a) formats.

plotOptions-treemap--colorByPoint.name: plotOptions-treemap--colorByPoint
plotOptions-treemap--colorByPoint.title: colorByPoint
plotOptions-treemap--colorByPoint.description: When using automatic point colors pulled from the options.colors collection, this option determines whether the chart should receive one color per series or one color per point.

plotOptions-arearange-tooltip--xDateForm.name: plotOptions-arearange-tooltip--xDateFormat
plotOptions-arearange-tooltip--xDateForm.title: xDateFormat
plotOptions-arearange-tooltip--xDateForm.description: The format for the date in the tooltip header if the X axis is a datetime axis. The default is a best guess based on the smallest distance between points in the chart.

plotOptions-bubble-marker-states-hover--.name: plotOptions-bubble-marker-states-hover--lineWidthPlus
plotOptions-bubble-marker-states-hover--.title: lineWidthPlus
plotOptions-bubble-marker-states-hover--.description: The additional line width for a hovered point.

plotOptions-heatmap-dataLabels--color.name: plotOptions-heatmap-dataLabels--color
plotOptions-heatmap-dataLabels--color.title: color
plotOptions-heatmap-dataLabels--color.description: The text color for the data labels. Defaults to null.

plotOptions-scatter-marker--radius.name: plotOptions-scatter-marker--radius
plotOptions-scatter-marker--radius.title: radius
plotOptions-scatter-marker--radius.description: The radius of the point marker.

plotOptions-boxplot--pointStart.name: plotOptions-boxplot--pointStart
plotOptions-boxplot--pointStart.title: pointStart
plotOptions-boxplot--pointStart.description: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945.

plotOptions-solidgauge--selected.name: plotOptions-solidgauge--selected
plotOptions-solidgauge--selected.title: selected
plotOptions-solidgauge--selected.description: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series.

data--dateFormat.name: data--dateFormat
data--dateFormat.title: dateFormat
data--dateFormat.description:
Which of the predefined date formats in Date.prototype.dateFormats to use to parse date values. Defaults to a best guess based on what format gives valid and ordered dates.

Valid options include:

  • YYYY-mm-dd
  • dd/mm/YYYY
  • mm/dd/YYYY
  • dd/mm/YY
  • mm/dd/YY

plotOptions-funnel-tooltip--followTouchM.name: plotOptions-funnel-tooltip--followTouchMove
plotOptions-funnel-tooltip--followTouchM.title: followTouchMove
plotOptions-funnel-tooltip--followTouchM.description: Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove.

plotOptions-area-dataLabels--x.name: plotOptions-area-dataLabels--x
plotOptions-area-dataLabels--x.title: x
plotOptions-area-dataLabels--x.description: The x position offset of the label relative to the point.

plotOptions-pyramid-states-hover-marker-.name: plotOptions-pyramid-states-hover-marker--fillColor
plotOptions-pyramid-states-hover-marker-.title: fillColor
plotOptions-pyramid-states-hover-marker-.description: The fill color of the point marker. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

plotOptions-line--lineWidth.name: plotOptions-line--lineWidth
plotOptions-line--lineWidth.title: lineWidth
plotOptions-line--lineWidth.description: Pixel with of the graph line.

plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover-marker--lineColor
plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover.title: lineColor
plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover.description: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

plotOptions-series--allowPointSelect.name: plotOptions-series--allowPointSelect
plotOptions-series--allowPointSelect.title: allowPointSelect
plotOptions-series--allowPointSelect.description: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices.

plotOptions-column-dataLabels--borderWid.name: plotOptions-column-dataLabels--borderWidth
plotOptions-column-dataLabels--borderWid.title: borderWidth
plotOptions-column-dataLabels--borderWid.description: The border width in pixels for the data label.

plotOptions-gauge-tooltip--footerFormat.name: plotOptions-gauge-tooltip--footerFormat
plotOptions-gauge-tooltip--footerFormat.title: footerFormat
plotOptions-gauge-tooltip--footerFormat.description: A string to append to the tooltip format.

plotOptions-line--visible.name: plotOptions-line--visible
plotOptions-line--visible.title: visible
plotOptions-line--visible.description: Set the initial visibility of the series.

plotOptions-spline--negativeColor.name: plotOptions-spline--negativeColor
plotOptions-spline--negativeColor.title: negativeColor
plotOptions-spline--negativeColor.description: The color for the parts of the graph or points that are below the threshold.

plotOptions-solidgauge--stickyTracking.name: plotOptions-solidgauge--stickyTracking
plotOptions-solidgauge--stickyTracking.title: stickyTracking
plotOptions-solidgauge--stickyTracking.description: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true for line and area type series, but to false for columns, pies etc.

plotOptions-arearange--showCheckbox.name: plotOptions-arearange--showCheckbox
plotOptions-arearange--showCheckbox.title: showCheckbox
plotOptions-arearange--showCheckbox.description: If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option.

legend--floating.name: legend--floating
legend--floating.title: floating
legend--floating.description: When the legend is floating, the plot area ignores it and is allowed to be placed below it.

plotOptions-line-states-hover-halo--attr.name: plotOptions-line-states-hover-halo--attributes
plotOptions-line-states-hover-halo--attr.title: attributes
plotOptions-line-states-hover-halo--attr.description: A collection of SVG attributes to override the appearance of the halo, for example fill, stroke and stroke-width.

plotOptions-areaspline-marker-states-hov.name: plotOptions-areaspline-marker-states-hover--lineWidth
plotOptions-areaspline-marker-states-hov.title: lineWidth
plotOptions-areaspline-marker-states-hov.description: The width of the point marker's outline.

plotOptions-columnrange-tooltip--followT.name: plotOptions-columnrange-tooltip--followTouchMove
plotOptions-columnrange-tooltip--followT.title: followTouchMove
plotOptions-columnrange-tooltip--followT.description: Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove.

plotOptions-columnrange--stickyTracking.name: plotOptions-columnrange--stickyTracking
plotOptions-columnrange--stickyTracking.title: stickyTracking
plotOptions-columnrange--stickyTracking.description: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true for line and area type series, but to false for columns, pies etc.

plotOptions-bubble-dataLabels--align.name: plotOptions-bubble-dataLabels--align
plotOptions-bubble-dataLabels--align.title: align
plotOptions-bubble-dataLabels--align.description: The alignment of the data label compared to the point. If right, the right side of the label should be touching the point. For points with an extent, like columns, the alignments also dictates how to align it inside the box, as given with the inside option. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right".

plotOptions-area--connectEnds.name: plotOptions-area--connectEnds
plotOptions-area--connectEnds.title: connectEnds
plotOptions-area--connectEnds.description: Polar charts only. Whether to connect the ends of a line series plot across the extremes.

plotOptions-scatter-tooltip--xDateFormat.name: plotOptions-scatter-tooltip--xDateFormat
plotOptions-scatter-tooltip--xDateFormat.title: xDateFormat
plotOptions-scatter-tooltip--xDateFormat.description: The format for the date in the tooltip header if the X axis is a datetime axis. The default is a best guess based on the smallest distance between points in the chart.

xAxis-labels--step.name: xAxis-labels--step
xAxis-labels--step.title: step
xAxis-labels--step.description:
To show only every n'th label on the axis, set the step to n. Setting the step to 2 shows every other label.

By default, the step is calculated automatically to avoid overlap. To prevent this, set it to 1. This usually only happens on a category axis, and is often a sign that you have chosen the wrong axis type. Read more at Axis docs => What axis should I use?

plotOptions-funnel--neckWidth.name: plotOptions-funnel--neckWidth
plotOptions-funnel--neckWidth.title: neckWidth
plotOptions-funnel--neckWidth.description: The width of the neck, the lower part of the funnel. A number defines pixel width, a percentage string defines a percentage of the plot area width.

plotOptions-polygon-marker-states-select.name: plotOptions-polygon-marker-states-select--fillColor
plotOptions-polygon-marker-states-select.title: fillColor
plotOptions-polygon-marker-states-select.description: The fill color of the point marker.

plotOptions-waterfall--cursor.name: plotOptions-waterfall--cursor
plotOptions-waterfall--cursor.title: cursor
plotOptions-waterfall--cursor.description: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to  the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked.

plotOptions-areasplinerange--allowPointS.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange--allowPointSelect
plotOptions-areasplinerange--allowPointS.title: allowPointSelect
plotOptions-areasplinerange--allowPointS.description: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices.

plotOptions-arearange--negativeColor.name: plotOptions-arearange--negativeColor
plotOptions-arearange--negativeColor.title: negativeColor
plotOptions-arearange--negativeColor.description: The color for the parts of the graph or points that are below the threshold.

plotOptions-polygon-states-hover-marker-.name: plotOptions-polygon-states-hover-marker--height
plotOptions-polygon-states-hover-marker-.title: height
plotOptions-polygon-states-hover-marker-.description: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a width must also be set.

plotOptions-scatter--shadow.name: plotOptions-scatter--shadow
plotOptions-scatter--shadow.title: shadow
plotOptions-scatter--shadow.description: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

plotOptions-arearange--selected.name: plotOptions-arearange--selected
plotOptions-arearange--selected.title: selected
plotOptions-arearange--selected.description: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series.

plotOptions-polygon-dataLabels--vertical.name: plotOptions-polygon-dataLabels--verticalAlign
plotOptions-polygon-dataLabels--vertical.title: verticalAlign
plotOptions-polygon-dataLabels--vertical.description: The vertical alignment of a data label. Can be one of top, middle or bottom. The default value depends on the data, for instance in a column chart, the label is above positive values and below negative values.

plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--allowOve.name: plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--allowOverlap
plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--allowOve.title: allowOverlap
plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--allowOve.description: Whether to allow data labels to overlap. To make the labels less sensitive for overlapping, the dataLabels.padding can be set to 0.

plotOptions-arearange--connectNulls.name: plotOptions-arearange--connectNulls
plotOptions-arearange--connectNulls.title: connectNulls
plotOptions-arearange--connectNulls.description: Whether to connect a graph line across null points.

plotOptions-pyramid-tooltip--shape.name: plotOptions-pyramid-tooltip--shape
plotOptions-pyramid-tooltip--shape.title: shape
plotOptions-pyramid-tooltip--shape.description: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the tooltip. In Highcharts 3.x and less, the shape was square.

plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--inside.name: plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--inside
plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--inside.title: inside
plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--inside.description: For points with an extent, like columns, whether to align the data label inside the box or to the actual value point. Defaults to false in most cases, true in stacked columns.

yAxis--maxPadding.name: yAxis--maxPadding
yAxis--maxPadding.title: maxPadding
yAxis--maxPadding.description: Padding of the max value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the highest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area.

legend--reversed.name: legend--reversed
legend--reversed.title: reversed
legend--reversed.description: Whether to reverse the order of the legend items compared to the order of the series or points as defined in the configuration object.

plotOptions-boxplot-states-hover-halo--s.name: plotOptions-boxplot-states-hover-halo--size
plotOptions-boxplot-states-hover-halo--s.title: size
plotOptions-boxplot-states-hover-halo--s.description: The pixel size of the halo. For point markers this is the radius of the halo. For pie slices it is the width of the halo outside the slice. For bubbles it defaults to 5 and is the width of the halo outside the bubble.

plotOptions-arearange--lineColor.name: plotOptions-arearange--lineColor
plotOptions-arearange--lineColor.title: lineColor
plotOptions-arearange--lineColor.description: A separate color for the graph line. By default the line takes the color of the series, but the lineColor setting allows setting a separate color for the line without altering the fillColor.

plotOptions-pie-dataLabels--connectorPad.name: plotOptions-pie-dataLabels--connectorPadding
plotOptions-pie-dataLabels--connectorPad.title: connectorPadding
plotOptions-pie-dataLabels--connectorPad.description: The distance from the data label to the connector.

plotOptions-bar-dataLabels--enabled.name: plotOptions-bar-dataLabels--enabled
plotOptions-bar-dataLabels--enabled.title: enabled
plotOptions-bar-dataLabels--enabled.description: Enable or disable the data labels.

plotOptions-columnrange-zones--dashStyle.name: plotOptions-columnrange-zones--dashStyle
plotOptions-columnrange-zones--dashStyle.title: dashStyle
plotOptions-columnrange-zones--dashStyle.description: A name for the dash style to use for the graph.

plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--inside
plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--.title: inside
plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--.description: For points with an extent, like columns, whether to align the data label inside the box or to the actual value point. Defaults to false in most cases, true in stacked columns.

xAxis-labels--x.name: xAxis-labels--x
xAxis-labels--x.title: x
xAxis-labels--x.description: The x position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis.

xAxis-labels--y.name: xAxis-labels--y
xAxis-labels--y.title: y
xAxis-labels--y.description: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. The default makes it adapt to the font size on bottom axis.

plotOptions-series-zones--fillColor.name: plotOptions-series-zones--fillColor
plotOptions-series-zones--fillColor.title: fillColor
plotOptions-series-zones--fillColor.description: Defines the fill color for the series (in area type series)

xAxis--minorTickInterval.name: xAxis--minorTickInterval
xAxis--minorTickInterval.title: minorTickInterval
xAxis--minorTickInterval.description:
Tick interval in scale units for the minor ticks. On a linear axis, if "auto", the minor tick interval is calculated as a fifth of the tickInterval. If null, minor ticks are not shown.

On logarithmic axes, the unit is the power of the value. For example, setting the minorTickInterval to 1 puts one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. Setting the minorTickInterval to 0.1 produces 9 ticks between 1 and 10, 10 and 100 etc. A minorTickInterval of "auto" on a log axis results in a best guess, attempting to enter approximately 5 minor ticks between each major tick.

If user settings dictate minor ticks to become too dense, they don't make sense, and will be ignored to prevent performance problems.

On axes using categories, minor ticks are not supported.

plotOptions-waterfall-zones--dashStyle.name: plotOptions-waterfall-zones--dashStyle
plotOptions-waterfall-zones--dashStyle.title: dashStyle
plotOptions-waterfall-zones--dashStyle.description: A name for the dash style to use for the graph.

lang--thousandsSep.name: lang--thousandsSep
lang--thousandsSep.title: thousandsSep
lang--thousandsSep.description: The default thousands separator used in the Highcharts.numberFormat method unless otherwise specified in the function arguments. Since Highcharts 4.1 it defaults to a single space character, which is compatible with ISO and works across Anglo-American and continental European languages.

plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--backgrou.name: plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--backgroundColor
plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--backgrou.title: backgroundColor
plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--backgrou.description: The background color or gradient for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

plotOptions-bubble-zones--fillColor.name: plotOptions-bubble-zones--fillColor
plotOptions-bubble-zones--fillColor.title: fillColor
plotOptions-bubble-zones--fillColor.description: Defines the fill color for the series (in area type series)

plotOptions-solidgauge--overshoot.name: plotOptions-solidgauge--overshoot
plotOptions-solidgauge--overshoot.title: overshoot
plotOptions-solidgauge--overshoot.description: Allow the dial to overshoot the end of the perimeter axis by this many degrees. Say if the gauge axis goes from 0 to 60, a value of 100, or 1000, will show 5 degrees beyond the end of the axis.

plotOptions-bar-states-hover-marker--lin.name: plotOptions-bar-states-hover-marker--lineColor
plotOptions-bar-states-hover-marker--lin.title: lineColor
plotOptions-bar-states-hover-marker--lin.description: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

plotOptions-heatmap--cropThreshold.name: plotOptions-heatmap--cropThreshold
plotOptions-heatmap--cropThreshold.title: cropThreshold
plotOptions-heatmap--cropThreshold.description: When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn,  event if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series.  .

plotOptions-column--pointIntervalUnit.name: plotOptions-column--pointIntervalUnit
plotOptions-column--pointIntervalUnit.title: pointIntervalUnit
plotOptions-column--pointIntervalUnit.description: On datetime series, this allows for setting the pointInterval to the two irregular time units, month and year. Combine it with pointInterval to draw quarters, 6 months, 10 years etc.

plotOptions-column-dataLabels--format.name: plotOptions-column-dataLabels--format
plotOptions-column-dataLabels--format.title: format
plotOptions-column-dataLabels--format.description: A format string for the data label. Available variables are the same as for formatter.

plotOptions-bubble--zMin.name: plotOptions-bubble--zMin
plotOptions-bubble--zMin.title: zMin
plotOptions-bubble--zMin.description: The minimum for the Z value range. Defaults to the lowest Z value in the data.

plotOptions-treemap-tooltip--valueDecima.name: plotOptions-treemap-tooltip--valueDecimals
plotOptions-treemap-tooltip--valueDecima.title: valueDecimals
plotOptions-treemap-tooltip--valueDecima.description: How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.

plotOptions-bar-tooltip--pointFormat.name: plotOptions-bar-tooltip--pointFormat
plotOptions-bar-tooltip--pointFormat.title: pointFormat
plotOptions-bar-tooltip--pointFormat.description: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.yPrefix and tooltip.ySuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units.

plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--val.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--valuePrefix
plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--val.title: valuePrefix
plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--val.description: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

plotOptions-waterfall--threshold.name: plotOptions-waterfall--threshold
plotOptions-waterfall--threshold.title: threshold
plotOptions-waterfall--threshold.description: The Y axis value to serve as the base for the columns, for distinguishing between values above and below a threshold. If null, the columns extend from the padding Y axis minimum.

plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--defer
plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--.title: defer
plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--.description: Whether to defer displaying the data labels until the initial series animation has finished.

plotOptions-treemap-tooltip--pointFormat.name: plotOptions-treemap-tooltip--pointFormat
plotOptions-treemap-tooltip--pointFormat.title: pointFormat
plotOptions-treemap-tooltip--pointFormat.description: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.yPrefix and tooltip.ySuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units.

plotOptions-errorbar--color.name: plotOptions-errorbar--color
plotOptions-errorbar--color.title: color
plotOptions-errorbar--color.description: The main color of the bars. This can be overridden by stemColor and whiskerColor individually.

plotOptions-heatmap-dataLabels--zIndex.name: plotOptions-heatmap-dataLabels--zIndex
plotOptions-heatmap-dataLabels--zIndex.title: zIndex
plotOptions-heatmap-dataLabels--zIndex.description: The Z index of the data labels. The default Z index puts it above the series. Use a Z index of 2 to display it behind the series.

plotOptions-boxplot--color.name: plotOptions-boxplot--color
plotOptions-boxplot--color.title: color
plotOptions-boxplot--color.description: The main color or the series. In line type series it applies to the line and the point markers unless otherwise specified. In bar type series it applies to the bars unless a color is specified per point. The default value is pulled from the options.colors array.

plotOptions-funnel--neckHeight.name: plotOptions-funnel--neckHeight
plotOptions-funnel--neckHeight.title: neckHeight
plotOptions-funnel--neckHeight.description: The height of the neck, the lower part of the funnel. A number defines pixel width, a percentage string defines a percentage of the plot area height.

plotOptions-arearange-zones--value.name: plotOptions-arearange-zones--value
plotOptions-arearange-zones--value.title: value
plotOptions-arearange-zones--value.description: The value up to where the zone extends, if undefined the zones stretches to the last value in the series.

chart--plotShadow.name: chart--plotShadow
chart--plotShadow.title: plotShadow
chart--plotShadow.description: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the plot area. Requires that plotBackgroundColor be set. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

plotOptions-scatter--zoneAxis.name: plotOptions-scatter--zoneAxis
plotOptions-scatter--zoneAxis.title: zoneAxis
plotOptions-scatter--zoneAxis.description: Defines the Axis on which the zones are applied.

data--startRow.name: data--startRow
data--startRow.title: startRow
data--startRow.description: In tabular input data, the first row (indexed by 0) to use.

plotOptions-polygon-marker--width.name: plotOptions-polygon-marker--width
plotOptions-polygon-marker--width.title: width
plotOptions-polygon-marker--width.description: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a height must also be set.

plotOptions-series-states-hover--lineWid.name: plotOptions-series-states-hover--lineWidth
plotOptions-series-states-hover--lineWid.title: lineWidth
plotOptions-series-states-hover--lineWid.description: Pixel with of the graph line.

plotOptions-columnrange-dataLabels--useH.name: plotOptions-columnrange-dataLabels--useHTML
plotOptions-columnrange-dataLabels--useH.title: useHTML
plotOptions-columnrange-dataLabels--useH.description: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

tooltip--borderRadius.name: tooltip--borderRadius
tooltip--borderRadius.title: borderRadius
tooltip--borderRadius.description: The radius of the rounded border corners.

plotOptions-solidgauge-tooltip--footerFo.name: plotOptions-solidgauge-tooltip--footerFormat
plotOptions-solidgauge-tooltip--footerFo.title: footerFormat
plotOptions-solidgauge-tooltip--footerFo.description: A string to append to the tooltip format.

plotOptions-gauge-dial--rearLength.name: plotOptions-gauge-dial--rearLength
plotOptions-gauge-dial--rearLength.title: rearLength
plotOptions-gauge-dial--rearLength.description: The length of the dial's rear end, the part that extends out on the other side of the pivot. Relative to the dial's length.

plotOptions-treemap-states-hover-marker-.name: plotOptions-treemap-states-hover-marker--fillColor
plotOptions-treemap-states-hover-marker-.title: fillColor
plotOptions-treemap-states-hover-marker-.description: The fill color of the point marker. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

plotOptions-series--pointPlacement.name: plotOptions-series--pointPlacement
plotOptions-series--pointPlacement.title: pointPlacement
plotOptions-series--pointPlacement.description:
Possible values: null, "on", "between".

In a column chart, when pointPlacement is "on", the point will not create any padding of the X axis. In a polar column chart this means that the first column points directly north. If the pointPlacement is "between", the columns will be laid out between ticks. This is useful for example for visualising an amount between two points in time or in a certain sector of a polar chart.

Since Highcharts 3.0.2, the point placement can also be numeric, where 0 is on the axis value, -0.5 is between this value and the previous, and 0.5 is between this value and the next. Unlike the textual options, numeric point placement options won't affect axis padding.

Defaults to null in cartesian charts, "between" in polar charts.

plotOptions-bubble--pointInterval.name: plotOptions-bubble--pointInterval
plotOptions-bubble--pointInterval.title: pointInterval
plotOptions-bubble--pointInterval.description:
If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointInterval defines the interval of the x values. For example, if a series contains one value every decade starting from year 0, set pointInterval to 10.

Since Highcharts 4.1, it can be combined with pointIntervalUnit to draw irregular intervals.

credits--enabled.name: credits--enabled
credits--enabled.title: enabled
credits--enabled.description: Whether to show the credits text.

plotOptions-bar--negativeColor.name: plotOptions-bar--negativeColor
plotOptions-bar--negativeColor.title: negativeColor
plotOptions-bar--negativeColor.description: The color for the parts of the graph or points that are below the threshold.

plotOptions-bar--pointPadding.name: plotOptions-bar--pointPadding
plotOptions-bar--pointPadding.title: pointPadding
plotOptions-bar--pointPadding.description: Padding between each column or bar, in x axis units.

plotOptions-spline--connectEnds.name: plotOptions-spline--connectEnds
plotOptions-spline--connectEnds.title: connectEnds
plotOptions-spline--connectEnds.description: Polar charts only. Whether to connect the ends of a line series plot across the extremes.

plotOptions-pyramid--zoneAxis.name: plotOptions-pyramid--zoneAxis
plotOptions-pyramid--zoneAxis.title: zoneAxis
plotOptions-pyramid--zoneAxis.description: Defines the Axis on which the zones are applied.

xAxis--allowDecimals.name: xAxis--allowDecimals
xAxis--allowDecimals.title: allowDecimals
xAxis--allowDecimals.description: Whether to allow decimals in this axis' ticks. When counting integers, like persons or hits on a web page, decimals must be avoided in the axis tick labels.

plotOptions-series--linkedTo.name: plotOptions-series--linkedTo
plotOptions-series--linkedTo.title: linkedTo
plotOptions-series--linkedTo.description: The id of another series to link to. Additionally, the value can be ":previous" to link to the previous series. When two series are linked, only the first one appears in the legend. Toggling the visibility of this also toggles the linked series.

plotOptions-spline-states-hover-marker--.name: plotOptions-spline-states-hover-marker--symbol
plotOptions-spline-states-hover-marker--.title: symbol
plotOptions-spline-states-hover-marker--.description:
A predefined shape or symbol for the marker. When null, the symbol is pulled from options.symbols. Other possible values are "circle", "square", "diamond", "triangle" and "triangle-down".

Additionally, the URL to a graphic can be given on this form: "url(graphic.png)". Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.

Custom callbacks for symbol path generation can also be added to Highcharts.SVGRenderer.prototype.symbols. The callback is then used by its method name, as shown in the demo.

plotOptions-scatter-marker-states-hover-.name: plotOptions-scatter-marker-states-hover--lineWidth
plotOptions-scatter-marker-states-hover-.title: lineWidth
plotOptions-scatter-marker-states-hover-.description: The width of the point marker's outline.

title--style.name: title--style
title--style.title: style
title--style.description: CSS styles for the title. Use this for font styling, but use align, x and y for text alignment.

plotOptions-column--visible.name: plotOptions-column--visible
plotOptions-column--visible.title: visible
plotOptions-column--visible.description: Set the initial visibility of the series.

plotOptions-pie-states-hover-halo--attri.name: plotOptions-pie-states-hover-halo--attributes
plotOptions-pie-states-hover-halo--attri.title: attributes
plotOptions-pie-states-hover-halo--attri.description: A collection of SVG attributes to override the appearance of the halo, for example fill, stroke and stroke-width.

plotOptions-errorbar--pointRange.name: plotOptions-errorbar--pointRange
plotOptions-errorbar--pointRange.title: pointRange
plotOptions-errorbar--pointRange.description: The X axis range that each point is valid for. This determines the width of the column. On a categorized axis, the range will be 1 by default (one category unit). On linear and datetime axes, the range will be computed as the distance between the two closest data points.

plotOptions-scatter-marker-states-select.name: plotOptions-scatter-marker-states-select--radius
plotOptions-scatter-marker-states-select.title: radius
plotOptions-scatter-marker-states-select.description:
The radius of the point marker. In hover state, it defaults
		to the normal state's radius + 2.

global--VMLRadialGradientURL.name: global--VMLRadialGradientURL
global--VMLRadialGradientURL.title: VMLRadialGradientURL
global--VMLRadialGradientURL.description: Path to the pattern image required by VML browsers in order to draw radial gradients.

xAxis-title--rotation.name: xAxis-title--rotation
xAxis-title--rotation.title: rotation
xAxis-title--rotation.description: The rotation of the text in degrees. 0 is horizontal, 270 is vertical reading from bottom to top.

plotOptions-bar-dataLabels--verticalAlig.name: plotOptions-bar-dataLabels--verticalAlign
plotOptions-bar-dataLabels--verticalAlig.title: verticalAlign
plotOptions-bar-dataLabels--verticalAlig.description: The vertical alignment of a data label. Can be one of top, middle or bottom. The default value depends on the data, for instance in a column chart, the label is above positive values and below negative values.

plotOptions-line-dataLabels--verticalAli.name: plotOptions-line-dataLabels--verticalAlign
plotOptions-line-dataLabels--verticalAli.title: verticalAlign
plotOptions-line-dataLabels--verticalAli.description: The vertical alignment of a data label. Can be one of top, middle or bottom. The default value depends on the data, for instance in a column chart, the label is above positive values and below negative values.

chart--type.name: chart--type
chart--type.title: type
chart--type.description: The default series type for the chart. Can be any of the chart types listed under plotOptions.

plotOptions-gauge-tooltip--headerFormat.name: plotOptions-gauge-tooltip--headerFormat
plotOptions-gauge-tooltip--headerFormat.title: headerFormat
plotOptions-gauge-tooltip--headerFormat.description:
The HTML of the tooltip header line. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.key, series.name, series.color and other members from the point and series objects. The point.key variable contains the category name, x value or datetime string depending on the type of axis. For datetime axes, the point.key date format can be set using tooltip.xDateFormat.

Defaults to <span style="font-size: 10px">{point.key}</span><br/>

plotOptions-polygon-marker-states-hover-.name: plotOptions-polygon-marker-states-hover--fillColor
plotOptions-polygon-marker-states-hover-.title: fillColor
plotOptions-polygon-marker-states-hover-.description: The fill color of the marker in hover state.

plotOptions-pie-tooltip--xDateFormat.name: plotOptions-pie-tooltip--xDateFormat
plotOptions-pie-tooltip--xDateFormat.title: xDateFormat
plotOptions-pie-tooltip--xDateFormat.description: The format for the date in the tooltip header if the X axis is a datetime axis. The default is a best guess based on the smallest distance between points in the chart.

plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-mar.name: plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-marker--lineColor
plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-mar.title: lineColor
plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-mar.description: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

tooltip--valueDecimals.name: tooltip--valueDecimals
tooltip--valueDecimals.title: valueDecimals
tooltip--valueDecimals.description: How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.

plotOptions-solidgauge-states-hover-mark.name: plotOptions-solidgauge-states-hover-marker--symbol
plotOptions-solidgauge-states-hover-mark.title: symbol
plotOptions-solidgauge-states-hover-mark.description:
A predefined shape or symbol for the marker. When null, the symbol is pulled from options.symbols. Other possible values are "circle", "square", "diamond", "triangle" and "triangle-down".

Additionally, the URL to a graphic can be given on this form: "url(graphic.png)". Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.

Custom callbacks for symbol path generation can also be added to Highcharts.SVGRenderer.prototype.symbols. The callback is then used by its method name, as shown in the demo.

plotOptions-columnrange--pointRange.name: plotOptions-columnrange--pointRange
plotOptions-columnrange--pointRange.title: pointRange
plotOptions-columnrange--pointRange.description: The X axis range that each point is valid for. This determines the width of the column. On a categorized axis, the range will be 1 by default (one category unit). On linear and datetime axes, the range will be computed as the distance between the two closest data points.

navigation-buttonOptions--width.name: navigation-buttonOptions--width
navigation-buttonOptions--width.title: width
navigation-buttonOptions--width.description: The pixel width of the button.

plotOptions-area-marker-states-select--l.name: plotOptions-area-marker-states-select--lineColor
plotOptions-area-marker-states-select--l.title: lineColor
plotOptions-area-marker-states-select--l.description: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

plotOptions-polygon--selected.name: plotOptions-polygon--selected
plotOptions-polygon--selected.title: selected
plotOptions-polygon--selected.description: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series.

plotOptions-bar-states-hover-halo--size.name: plotOptions-bar-states-hover-halo--size
plotOptions-bar-states-hover-halo--size.title: size
plotOptions-bar-states-hover-halo--size.description: The pixel size of the halo. For point markers this is the radius of the halo. For pie slices it is the width of the halo outside the slice. For bubbles it defaults to 5 and is the width of the halo outside the bubble.

plotOptions-pie--slicedOffset.name: plotOptions-pie--slicedOffset
plotOptions-pie--slicedOffset.title: slicedOffset
plotOptions-pie--slicedOffset.description: If a point is sliced, moved out from the center, how many pixels should  it be moved?.

plotOptions-column--grouping.name: plotOptions-column--grouping
plotOptions-column--grouping.title: grouping
plotOptions-column--grouping.description: Whether to group non-stacked columns or to let them render independent of each other. Non-grouped columns will be laid out individually and overlap each other.

plotOptions-areaspline-marker--fillColor.name: plotOptions-areaspline-marker--fillColor
plotOptions-areaspline-marker--fillColor.title: fillColor
plotOptions-areaspline-marker--fillColor.description: The fill color of the point marker. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

plotOptions-solidgauge-tooltip--followTo.name: plotOptions-solidgauge-tooltip--followTouchMove
plotOptions-solidgauge-tooltip--followTo.title: followTouchMove
plotOptions-solidgauge-tooltip--followTo.description: Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove.

plotOptions-line-dataLabels--x.name: plotOptions-line-dataLabels--x
plotOptions-line-dataLabels--x.title: x
plotOptions-line-dataLabels--x.description: The x position offset of the label relative to the point.

plotOptions-spline-dataLabels--enabled.name: plotOptions-spline-dataLabels--enabled
plotOptions-spline-dataLabels--enabled.title: enabled
plotOptions-spline-dataLabels--enabled.description: Enable or disable the data labels.

plotOptions-line-dataLabels--y.name: plotOptions-line-dataLabels--y
plotOptions-line-dataLabels--y.title: y
plotOptions-line-dataLabels--y.description: The y position offset of the label relative to the point.

plotOptions-treemap--visible.name: plotOptions-treemap--visible
plotOptions-treemap--visible.title: visible
plotOptions-treemap--visible.description: Set the initial visibility of the series.

plotOptions-scatter-marker-states-hover-.name: plotOptions-scatter-marker-states-hover--enabled
plotOptions-scatter-marker-states-hover-.title: enabled
plotOptions-scatter-marker-states-hover-.description: Enable or disable the point marker.

plotOptions-arearange--turboThreshold.name: plotOptions-arearange--turboThreshold
plotOptions-arearange--turboThreshold.title: turboThreshold
plotOptions-arearange--turboThreshold.description: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Set it to 0 disable.

plotOptions-pyramid-zones--color.name: plotOptions-pyramid-zones--color
plotOptions-pyramid-zones--color.title: color
plotOptions-pyramid-zones--color.description: Defines the color of the series.

plotOptions-bar-states-hover-marker--wid.name: plotOptions-bar-states-hover-marker--width
plotOptions-bar-states-hover-marker--wid.title: width
plotOptions-bar-states-hover-marker--wid.description: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a height must also be set.

plotOptions-waterfall--showInLegend.name: plotOptions-waterfall--showInLegend
plotOptions-waterfall--showInLegend.title: showInLegend
plotOptions-waterfall--showInLegend.description: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. The default value is true for standalone series, false for linked series.

plotOptions-bubble-marker--fillColor.name: plotOptions-bubble-marker--fillColor
plotOptions-bubble-marker--fillColor.title: fillColor
plotOptions-bubble-marker--fillColor.description: The fill color of the point marker. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

tooltip--hideDelay.name: tooltip--hideDelay
tooltip--hideDelay.title: hideDelay
tooltip--hideDelay.description: The number of milliseconds to wait until the tooltip is hidden when mouse out from a point or chart.

plotOptions-areaspline-dataLabels--insid.name: plotOptions-areaspline-dataLabels--inside
plotOptions-areaspline-dataLabels--insid.title: inside
plotOptions-areaspline-dataLabels--insid.description: For points with an extent, like columns, whether to align the data label inside the box or to the actual value point. Defaults to false in most cases, true in stacked columns.

plotOptions-pie--visible.name: plotOptions-pie--visible
plotOptions-pie--visible.title: visible
plotOptions-pie--visible.description: Set the initial visibility of the series.

plotOptions-heatmap-tooltip--dateTimeLab.name: plotOptions-heatmap-tooltip--dateTimeLabelFormats
plotOptions-heatmap-tooltip--dateTimeLab.title: dateTimeLabelFormats
plotOptions-heatmap-tooltip--dateTimeLab.description:
For series on a datetime axes, the date format in the tooltip's header will by default be guessed based on the closest data points. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.

Defaults to: 

{
    millisecond:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S.%L",
    second:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S",
    minute:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M",
    hour:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M",
    day:"%A, %b %e, %Y",
    week:"Week from %A, %b %e, %Y",
    month:"%B %Y",
    year:"%Y"
}

plotOptions-bubble--zThreshold.name: plotOptions-bubble--zThreshold
plotOptions-bubble--zThreshold.title: zThreshold
plotOptions-bubble--zThreshold.description: When displayNegative is false, bubbles with lower Z values are skipped. When displayNegative is true and a negativeColor is given, points with lower Z is colored.

plotOptions-funnel--enableMouseTracking.name: plotOptions-funnel--enableMouseTracking
plotOptions-funnel--enableMouseTracking.title: enableMouseTracking
plotOptions-funnel--enableMouseTracking.description: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance.

plotOptions-treemap-tooltip--footerForma.name: plotOptions-treemap-tooltip--footerFormat
plotOptions-treemap-tooltip--footerForma.title: footerFormat
plotOptions-treemap-tooltip--footerForma.description: A string to append to the tooltip format.

plotOptions-treemap--borderColor.name: plotOptions-treemap--borderColor
plotOptions-treemap--borderColor.title: borderColor
plotOptions-treemap--borderColor.description: The color of the border surrounding each tree map item.

title--text.name: title--text
title--text.title: text
title--text.description: The title of the chart. To disable the title, set the text to null.

plotOptions-spline-tooltip--pointFormat.name: plotOptions-spline-tooltip--pointFormat
plotOptions-spline-tooltip--pointFormat.title: pointFormat
plotOptions-spline-tooltip--pointFormat.description: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.yPrefix and tooltip.ySuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units.

plotOptions-boxplot--stemColor.name: plotOptions-boxplot--stemColor
plotOptions-boxplot--stemColor.title: stemColor
plotOptions-boxplot--stemColor.description: The color of the stem, the vertical line extending from the box to the whiskers. If null, the series color is used.

plotOptions-area-dataLabels--zIndex.name: plotOptions-area-dataLabels--zIndex
plotOptions-area-dataLabels--zIndex.title: zIndex
plotOptions-area-dataLabels--zIndex.description: The Z index of the data labels. The default Z index puts it above the series. Use a Z index of 2 to display it behind the series.

plotOptions-columnrange--shadow.name: plotOptions-columnrange--shadow
plotOptions-columnrange--shadow.title: shadow
plotOptions-columnrange--shadow.description: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--inside.name: plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--inside
plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--inside.title: inside
plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--inside.description: For points with an extent, like columns, whether to align the data label inside the box or to the actual value point. Defaults to false in most cases, true in stacked columns.

plotOptions-areaspline--pointInterval.name: plotOptions-areaspline--pointInterval
plotOptions-areaspline--pointInterval.title: pointInterval
plotOptions-areaspline--pointInterval.description:
If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointInterval defines the interval of the x values. For example, if a series contains one value every decade starting from year 0, set pointInterval to 10.

Since Highcharts 4.1, it can be combined with pointIntervalUnit to draw irregular intervals.

plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--shadow.name: plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--shadow
plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--shadow.title: shadow
plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--shadow.description: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.
