plotOptions-bar--pointStart.description: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945.

plotOptions-areaspline-zones--dashStyle.name: plotOptions-areaspline-zones--dashStyle
plotOptions-areaspline-zones--dashStyle.title: dashStyle
plotOptions-areaspline-zones--dashStyle.description: A name for the dash style to use for the graph.

plotOptions-bar-tooltip--xDateFormat.name: plotOptions-bar-tooltip--xDateFormat
plotOptions-bar-tooltip--xDateFormat.title: xDateFormat
plotOptions-bar-tooltip--xDateFormat.description: The format for the date in the tooltip header if the X axis is a datetime axis. The default is a best guess based on the smallest distance between points in the chart.

plotOptions-series-tooltip--shape.name: plotOptions-series-tooltip--shape
plotOptions-series-tooltip--shape.title: shape
plotOptions-series-tooltip--shape.description: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the tooltip. In Highcharts 3.x and less, the shape was square.

plotOptions-pyramid--colors.name: plotOptions-pyramid--colors
plotOptions-pyramid--colors.title: colors
plotOptions-pyramid--colors.description: A series specific or series type specific color set to use instead of the global colors.

legend-title--text.name: legend-title--text
legend-title--text.title: text
legend-title--text.description: A text or HTML string for the title.

plotOptions-treemap-dataLabels--shadow.name: plotOptions-treemap-dataLabels--shadow
plotOptions-treemap-dataLabels--shadow.title: shadow
plotOptions-treemap-dataLabels--shadow.description: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

plotOptions-series-tooltip--followTouchM.name: plotOptions-series-tooltip--followTouchMove
plotOptions-series-tooltip--followTouchM.title: followTouchMove
plotOptions-series-tooltip--followTouchM.description: Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove.

plotOptions-polygon-dataLabels--align.name: plotOptions-polygon-dataLabels--align
plotOptions-polygon-dataLabels--align.title: align
plotOptions-polygon-dataLabels--align.description: The alignment of the data label compared to the point. If right, the right side of the label should be touching the point. For points with an extent, like columns, the alignments also dictates how to align it inside the box, as given with the inside option. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right".

xAxis-breaks--repeat.name: xAxis-breaks--repeat
xAxis-breaks--repeat.title: repeat
xAxis-breaks--repeat.description: Defines an interval after which the break appears again. By default the breaks do not repeat.

plotOptions-areaspline--turboThreshold.name: plotOptions-areaspline--turboThreshold
plotOptions-areaspline--turboThreshold.title: turboThreshold
plotOptions-areaspline--turboThreshold.description: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Set it to 0 disable.

plotOptions-column-states-hover-marker--.name: plotOptions-column-states-hover-marker--height
plotOptions-column-states-hover-marker--.title: height
plotOptions-column-states-hover-marker--.description: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a width must also be set.

plotOptions-waterfall-states-hover-marke.name: plotOptions-waterfall-states-hover-marker--fillColor
plotOptions-waterfall-states-hover-marke.title: fillColor
plotOptions-waterfall-states-hover-marke.description: The fill color of the point marker. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

legend-navigation--animation.name: legend-navigation--animation
legend-navigation--animation.title: animation
legend-navigation--animation.description: How to animate the pages when navigating up or down. A value of true applies the default navigation given in the chart.animation option. Additional options can be given as an object containing values for easing and duration. .

plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-mar.name: plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-marker--width
plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-mar.title: width
plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-mar.description: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a height must also be set.

plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--zIndex.name: plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--zIndex
plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--zIndex.title: zIndex
plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--zIndex.description: The Z index of the data labels. The default Z index puts it above the series. Use a Z index of 2 to display it behind the series.

plotOptions-arearange--cursor.name: plotOptions-arearange--cursor
plotOptions-arearange--cursor.title: cursor
plotOptions-arearange--cursor.description: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to  the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked.

plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--vertical.name: plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--verticalAlign
plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--vertical.title: verticalAlign
plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--vertical.description: The vertical alignment of a data label. Can be one of top, middle or bottom. The default value depends on the data, for instance in a column chart, the label is above positive values and below negative values.

plotOptions-gauge-dial--backgroundColor.name: plotOptions-gauge-dial--backgroundColor
plotOptions-gauge-dial--backgroundColor.title: backgroundColor
plotOptions-gauge-dial--backgroundColor.description: The background or fill color of the gauge's dial.

plotOptions-arearange-tooltip--dateTimeL.name: plotOptions-arearange-tooltip--dateTimeLabelFormats
plotOptions-arearange-tooltip--dateTimeL.title: dateTimeLabelFormats
plotOptions-arearange-tooltip--dateTimeL.description:
For series on a datetime axes, the date format in the tooltip's header will by default be guessed based on the closest data points. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.

Defaults to: 

{
    millisecond:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S.%L",
    second:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S",
    minute:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M",
    hour:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M",
    day:"%A, %b %e, %Y",
    week:"Week from %A, %b %e, %Y",
    month:"%B %Y",
    year:"%Y"
}

plotOptions-solidgauge-dataLabels--borde.name: plotOptions-solidgauge-dataLabels--borderColor
plotOptions-solidgauge-dataLabels--borde.title: borderColor
plotOptions-solidgauge-dataLabels--borde.description: The border color for the data label.

plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover-halo--size
plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover.title: size
plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover.description: The pixel size of the halo. For point markers this is the radius of the halo. For pie slices it is the width of the halo outside the slice. For bubbles it defaults to 5 and is the width of the halo outside the bubble.

plotOptions-column--stickyTracking.name: plotOptions-column--stickyTracking
plotOptions-column--stickyTracking.title: stickyTracking
plotOptions-column--stickyTracking.description: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true for line and area type series, but to false for columns, pies etc.

plotOptions-treemap--shadow.name: plotOptions-treemap--shadow
plotOptions-treemap--shadow.title: shadow
plotOptions-treemap--shadow.description: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

plotOptions-series-marker--width.name: plotOptions-series-marker--width
plotOptions-series-marker--width.title: width
plotOptions-series-marker--width.description: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a height must also be set.

plotOptions-series-marker--enabled.name: plotOptions-series-marker--enabled
plotOptions-series-marker--enabled.title: enabled
plotOptions-series-marker--enabled.description: Enable or disable the point marker.

plotOptions-boxplot--medianWidth.name: plotOptions-boxplot--medianWidth
plotOptions-boxplot--medianWidth.title: medianWidth
plotOptions-boxplot--medianWidth.description: The pixel width of the median line. If null, the lineWidth is used.

plotOptions-pie-states-hover-halo--opaci.name: plotOptions-pie-states-hover-halo--opacity
plotOptions-pie-states-hover-halo--opaci.title: opacity
plotOptions-pie-states-hover-halo--opaci.description: Opacity for the halo unless a specific fill is overridden using the attributes setting. Note that Highcharts is only able to apply opacity to colors of hex or rgb(a) formats.

plotOptions-areaspline-tooltip--dateTime.name: plotOptions-areaspline-tooltip--dateTimeLabelFormats
plotOptions-areaspline-tooltip--dateTime.title: dateTimeLabelFormats
plotOptions-areaspline-tooltip--dateTime.description:
For series on a datetime axes, the date format in the tooltip's header will by default be guessed based on the closest data points. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.

Defaults to: 

{
    millisecond:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S.%L",
    second:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S",
    minute:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M",
    hour:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M",
    day:"%A, %b %e, %Y",
    week:"Week from %A, %b %e, %Y",
    month:"%B %Y",
    year:"%Y"
}

plotOptions-series--selected.name: plotOptions-series--selected
plotOptions-series--selected.title: selected
plotOptions-series--selected.description: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series.

plotOptions-area-states-hover-marker--ra.name: plotOptions-area-states-hover-marker--radius
plotOptions-area-states-hover-marker--ra.title: radius
plotOptions-area-states-hover-marker--ra.description: The radius of the point marker.

plotOptions-areasplinerange--fillOpacity.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange--fillOpacity
plotOptions-areasplinerange--fillOpacity.title: fillOpacity
plotOptions-areasplinerange--fillOpacity.description: Fill opacity for the area. Note that when you set an explicit fillColor, the fillOpacity is not applied. Instead, you should define the opacity in the fillColor with an rgba color definition.

data--seriesMapping.name: data--seriesMapping
data--seriesMapping.title: seriesMapping
data--seriesMapping.description: An array containing object with Point property names along with what column id the property should be taken from.

plotOptions-treemap--interactByLeaf.name: plotOptions-treemap--interactByLeaf
plotOptions-treemap--interactByLeaf.title: interactByLeaf
plotOptions-treemap--interactByLeaf.description: This option decides if the user can interact with the parent nodes or just the leaf nodes. When this option is undefined, it will be true by default. However when allowDrillToNode is true, then it will be false by default.

plotOptions-line-states-hover-marker--sy.name: plotOptions-line-states-hover-marker--symbol
plotOptions-line-states-hover-marker--sy.title: symbol
plotOptions-line-states-hover-marker--sy.description:
A predefined shape or symbol for the marker. When null, the symbol is pulled from options.symbols. Other possible values are "circle", "square", "diamond", "triangle" and "triangle-down".

Additionally, the URL to a graphic can be given on this form: "url(graphic.png)". Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.

Custom callbacks for symbol path generation can also be added to Highcharts.SVGRenderer.prototype.symbols. The callback is then used by its method name, as shown in the demo.

plotOptions-areasplinerange--lineColor.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange--lineColor
plotOptions-areasplinerange--lineColor.title: lineColor
plotOptions-areasplinerange--lineColor.description: A separate color for the graph line. By default the line takes the color of the series, but the lineColor setting allows setting a separate color for the line without altering the fillColor.

plotOptions-spline-tooltip--headerFormat.name: plotOptions-spline-tooltip--headerFormat
plotOptions-spline-tooltip--headerFormat.title: headerFormat
plotOptions-spline-tooltip--headerFormat.description:
The HTML of the tooltip header line. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.key, series.name, series.color and other members from the point and series objects. The point.key variable contains the category name, x value or datetime string depending on the type of axis. For datetime axes, the point.key date format can be set using tooltip.xDateFormat.

Defaults to <span style="font-size: 10px">{point.key}</span><br/>

plotOptions-errorbar-states-hover--enabl.name: plotOptions-errorbar-states-hover--enabled
plotOptions-errorbar-states-hover--enabl.title: enabled
plotOptions-errorbar-states-hover--enabl.description: Enable separate styles for the hovered series to visualize that the user hovers either the series itself or the legend.			.

plotOptions-heatmap-tooltip--pointFormat.name: plotOptions-heatmap-tooltip--pointFormat
plotOptions-heatmap-tooltip--pointFormat.title: pointFormat
plotOptions-heatmap-tooltip--pointFormat.description: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.yPrefix and tooltip.ySuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units.

plotOptions-waterfall--edgeWidth.name: plotOptions-waterfall--edgeWidth
plotOptions-waterfall--edgeWidth.title: edgeWidth
plotOptions-waterfall--edgeWidth.description: 3D columns only. The width of the colored edges.

plotOptions-gauge-states-hover-marker--w.name: plotOptions-gauge-states-hover-marker--width
plotOptions-gauge-states-hover-marker--w.title: width
plotOptions-gauge-states-hover-marker--w.description: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a height must also be set.

plotOptions-bubble-states-hover--lineWid.name: plotOptions-bubble-states-hover--lineWidth
plotOptions-bubble-states-hover--lineWid.title: lineWidth
plotOptions-bubble-states-hover--lineWid.description: Pixel with of the graph line.

plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--overflow
plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--.title: overflow
plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--.description: How to handle data labels that flow outside the plot area. The default is justify, which aligns them inside the plot area. For columns and bars, this means it will be moved inside the bar. To display data labels outside the plot area, set crop to false and overflow to "none".

exporting--width.name: exporting--width
exporting--width.title: width
exporting--width.description: The pixel width of charts exported to PNG or JPG. As of Highcharts 3.0, the default pixel width is a function of the chart.width or exporting.sourceWidth and the exporting.scale.

yAxis-labels--padding.name: yAxis-labels--padding
yAxis-labels--padding.title: padding
yAxis-labels--padding.description: The pixel padding for axis labels, to ensure white space between them.

noData--style.name: noData--style
noData--style.title: style
noData--style.description: CSS styles for the no-data label.

xAxis--minorGridLineWidth.name: xAxis--minorGridLineWidth
xAxis--minorGridLineWidth.title: minorGridLineWidth
xAxis--minorGridLineWidth.description: Width of the minor, secondary grid lines.

legend--align.name: legend--align
legend--align.title: align
legend--align.description: The horizontal alignment of the legend box within the chart area. Valid values are "left", "center" and "right".

plotOptions-arearange--trackByArea.name: plotOptions-arearange--trackByArea
plotOptions-arearange--trackByArea.title: trackByArea
plotOptions-arearange--trackByArea.description: Whether the whole area or just the line should respond to mouseover tooltips and other mouse or touch events.

plotOptions-polygon--threshold.name: plotOptions-polygon--threshold
plotOptions-polygon--threshold.title: threshold
plotOptions-polygon--threshold.description: The threshold, also called zero level or base level. For line type series this is only used in conjunction with negativeColor.

plotOptions-pyramid--borderWidth.name: plotOptions-pyramid--borderWidth
plotOptions-pyramid--borderWidth.title: borderWidth
plotOptions-pyramid--borderWidth.description: The width of the border surrounding each slice.

plotOptions-area--pointIntervalUnit.name: plotOptions-area--pointIntervalUnit
plotOptions-area--pointIntervalUnit.title: pointIntervalUnit
plotOptions-area--pointIntervalUnit.description: On datetime series, this allows for setting the pointInterval to the two irregular time units, month and year. Combine it with pointInterval to draw quarters, 6 months, 10 years etc.

plotOptions-area-dataLabels--verticalAli.name: plotOptions-area-dataLabels--verticalAlign
plotOptions-area-dataLabels--verticalAli.title: verticalAlign
plotOptions-area-dataLabels--verticalAli.description: The vertical alignment of a data label. Can be one of top, middle or bottom. The default value depends on the data, for instance in a column chart, the label is above positive values and below negative values.

tooltip--valuePrefix.name: tooltip--valuePrefix
tooltip--valuePrefix.title: valuePrefix
tooltip--valuePrefix.description: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

plotOptions-pyramid-tooltip--headerForma.name: plotOptions-pyramid-tooltip--headerFormat
plotOptions-pyramid-tooltip--headerForma.title: headerFormat
plotOptions-pyramid-tooltip--headerForma.description:
The HTML of the tooltip header line. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.key, series.name, series.color and other members from the point and series objects. The point.key variable contains the category name, x value or datetime string depending on the type of axis. For datetime axes, the point.key date format can be set using tooltip.xDateFormat.

Defaults to <span style="font-size: 10px">{point.key}</span><br/>

plotOptions-area-states-hover-marker--wi.name: plotOptions-area-states-hover-marker--width
plotOptions-area-states-hover-marker--wi.title: width
plotOptions-area-states-hover-marker--wi.description: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a height must also be set.

plotOptions-errorbar--visible.name: plotOptions-errorbar--visible
plotOptions-errorbar--visible.title: visible
plotOptions-errorbar--visible.description: Set the initial visibility of the series.

plotOptions-spline--showCheckbox.name: plotOptions-spline--showCheckbox
plotOptions-spline--showCheckbox.title: showCheckbox
plotOptions-spline--showCheckbox.description: If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option.

plotOptions-areasplinerange--turboThresh.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange--turboThreshold
plotOptions-areasplinerange--turboThresh.title: turboThreshold
plotOptions-areasplinerange--turboThresh.description: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Set it to 0 disable.

plotOptions-pie-dataLabels--verticalAlig.name: plotOptions-pie-dataLabels--verticalAlign
plotOptions-pie-dataLabels--verticalAlig.title: verticalAlign
plotOptions-pie-dataLabels--verticalAlig.description: The vertical alignment of a data label. Can be one of top, middle or bottom. The default value depends on the data, for instance in a column chart, the label is above positive values and below negative values.

plotOptions-arearange--pointStart.name: plotOptions-arearange--pointStart
plotOptions-arearange--pointStart.title: pointStart
plotOptions-arearange--pointStart.description: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945.

yAxis-labels--useHTML.name: yAxis-labels--useHTML
yAxis-labels--useHTML.title: useHTML
yAxis-labels--useHTML.description: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--defer.name: plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--defer
plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--defer.title: defer
plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--defer.description: Whether to defer displaying the data labels until the initial series animation has finished.

plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--shadow.name: plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--shadow
plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--shadow.title: shadow
plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--shadow.description: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

plotOptions-treemap-tooltip--followPoint.name: plotOptions-treemap-tooltip--followPointer
plotOptions-treemap-tooltip--followPoint.title: followPointer
plotOptions-treemap-tooltip--followPoint.description:
Whether the tooltip should follow the mouse as it moves across columns, pie slices and other point types with an extent. By default it behaves this way for scatter, bubble and pie series by override in the plotOptions for those series types.

For touch moves to behave the same way, followTouchMove must be true also.

plotOptions-solidgauge-states-hover-mark.name: plotOptions-solidgauge-states-hover-marker--lineWidth
plotOptions-solidgauge-states-hover-mark.title: lineWidth
plotOptions-solidgauge-states-hover-mark.description: The width of the point marker's outline.

xAxis--opposite.name: xAxis--opposite
xAxis--opposite.title: opposite
xAxis--opposite.description: Whether to display the axis on the opposite side of the normal. The normal is on the left side for vertical axes and bottom for horizontal, so the opposite sides will be right and top respectively. This is typically used with dual or multiple axes.

plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--borderRa.name: plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--borderRadius
plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--borderRa.title: borderRadius
plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--borderRa.description: The border radius in pixels for the data label.

plotOptions-bar-dataLabels--borderRadius.name: plotOptions-bar-dataLabels--borderRadius
plotOptions-bar-dataLabels--borderRadius.title: borderRadius
plotOptions-bar-dataLabels--borderRadius.description: The border radius in pixels for the data label.

plotOptions-line-marker--width.name: plotOptions-line-marker--width
plotOptions-line-marker--width.title: width
plotOptions-line-marker--width.description: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a height must also be set.

plotOptions-column-states-hover-halo--si.name: plotOptions-column-states-hover-halo--size
plotOptions-column-states-hover-halo--si.title: size
plotOptions-column-states-hover-halo--si.description: The pixel size of the halo. For point markers this is the radius of the halo. For pie slices it is the width of the halo outside the slice. For bubbles it defaults to 5 and is the width of the halo outside the bubble.

plotOptions-funnel-states-hover--lineWid.name: plotOptions-funnel-states-hover--lineWidth
plotOptions-funnel-states-hover--lineWid.title: lineWidth
plotOptions-funnel-states-hover--lineWid.description: Pixel with of the graph line.

plotOptions-pyramid-states-hover-marker-.name: plotOptions-pyramid-states-hover-marker--lineWidth
plotOptions-pyramid-states-hover-marker-.title: lineWidth
plotOptions-pyramid-states-hover-marker-.description: The width of the point marker's outline.

plotOptions-bubble-marker-states-select-.name: plotOptions-bubble-marker-states-select--fillColor
plotOptions-bubble-marker-states-select-.title: fillColor
plotOptions-bubble-marker-states-select-.description: The fill color of the point marker.

plotOptions-bubble-dataLabels--padding.name: plotOptions-bubble-dataLabels--padding
plotOptions-bubble-dataLabels--padding.title: padding
plotOptions-bubble-dataLabels--padding.description: When either the borderWidth or the backgroundColor is set, this is the padding within the box.

plotOptions-arearange--stickyTracking.name: plotOptions-arearange--stickyTracking
plotOptions-arearange--stickyTracking.title: stickyTracking
plotOptions-arearange--stickyTracking.description: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true for line and area type series, but to false for columns, pies etc.

plotOptions-series-dataLabels--borderCol.name: plotOptions-series-dataLabels--borderColor
plotOptions-series-dataLabels--borderCol.title: borderColor
plotOptions-series-dataLabels--borderCol.description: The border color for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

plotOptions-arearange--cropThreshold.name: plotOptions-arearange--cropThreshold
plotOptions-arearange--cropThreshold.title: cropThreshold
plotOptions-arearange--cropThreshold.description: When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn,  event if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series.  .

plotOptions-boxplot--medianColor.name: plotOptions-boxplot--medianColor
plotOptions-boxplot--medianColor.title: medianColor
plotOptions-boxplot--medianColor.description: The color of the median line. If null, the general series color applies.

plotOptions-funnel-states-hover--enabled.name: plotOptions-funnel-states-hover--enabled
plotOptions-funnel-states-hover--enabled.title: enabled
plotOptions-funnel-states-hover--enabled.description: Enable separate styles for the hovered series to visualize that the user hovers either the series itself or the legend.			.

global--getTimezoneOffset.name: global--getTimezoneOffset
global--getTimezoneOffset.title: getTimezoneOffset
global--getTimezoneOffset.description: A callback to return the time zone offset for a given datetime. It takes the timestamp in terms of milliseconds since January 1 1970, and returns the timezone offset in minutes. This provides a hook for drawing time based charts in specific time zones using their local DST crossover dates, with the help of external libraries.

plotOptions-polygon-tooltip--dateTimeLab.name: plotOptions-polygon-tooltip--dateTimeLabelFormats
plotOptions-polygon-tooltip--dateTimeLab.title: dateTimeLabelFormats
plotOptions-polygon-tooltip--dateTimeLab.description:
For series on a datetime axes, the date format in the tooltip's header will by default be guessed based on the closest data points. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.

Defaults to: 

{
    millisecond:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S.%L",
    second:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S",
    minute:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M",
    hour:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M",
    day:"%A, %b %e, %Y",
    week:"Week from %A, %b %e, %Y",
    month:"%B %Y",
    year:"%Y"
}

plotOptions-funnel-tooltip--followPointe.name: plotOptions-funnel-tooltip--followPointer
plotOptions-funnel-tooltip--followPointe.title: followPointer
plotOptions-funnel-tooltip--followPointe.description:
Whether the tooltip should follow the mouse as it moves across columns, pie slices and other point types with an extent. By default it behaves this way for scatter, bubble and pie series by override in the plotOptions for those series types.

For touch moves to behave the same way, followTouchMove must be true also.

plotOptions-waterfall--shadow.name: plotOptions-waterfall--shadow
plotOptions-waterfall--shadow.title: shadow
plotOptions-waterfall--shadow.description: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

plotOptions-errorbar--allowPointSelect.name: plotOptions-errorbar--allowPointSelect
plotOptions-errorbar--allowPointSelect.title: allowPointSelect
plotOptions-errorbar--allowPointSelect.description: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices.

plotOptions-polygon--shadow.name: plotOptions-polygon--shadow
plotOptions-polygon--shadow.title: shadow
plotOptions-polygon--shadow.description: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

plotOptions-spline-states-hover--lineWid.name: plotOptions-spline-states-hover--lineWidth
plotOptions-spline-states-hover--lineWid.title: lineWidth
plotOptions-spline-states-hover--lineWid.description: Pixel with of the graph line.

plotOptions-arearange-states-hover-marke.name: plotOptions-arearange-states-hover-marker--fillColor
plotOptions-arearange-states-hover-marke.title: fillColor
plotOptions-arearange-states-hover-marke.description: The fill color of the point marker. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

plotOptions-errorbar--pointIntervalUnit.name: plotOptions-errorbar--pointIntervalUnit
plotOptions-errorbar--pointIntervalUnit.title: pointIntervalUnit
plotOptions-errorbar--pointIntervalUnit.description: On datetime series, this allows for setting the pointInterval to the two irregular time units, month and year. Combine it with pointInterval to draw quarters, 6 months, 10 years etc.

plotOptions-scatter-marker-states-hover-.name: plotOptions-scatter-marker-states-hover--lineColor
plotOptions-scatter-marker-states-hover-.title: lineColor
plotOptions-scatter-marker-states-hover-.description: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

plotOptions-waterfall-states-hover--line.name: plotOptions-waterfall-states-hover--lineWidth
plotOptions-waterfall-states-hover--line.title: lineWidth
plotOptions-waterfall-states-hover--line.description: Pixel with of the graph line.

plotOptions-areaspline--linkedTo.name: plotOptions-areaspline--linkedTo
plotOptions-areaspline--linkedTo.title: linkedTo
plotOptions-areaspline--linkedTo.description: The id of another series to link to. Additionally, the value can be ":previous" to link to the previous series. When two series are linked, only the first one appears in the legend. Toggling the visibility of this also toggles the linked series.

plotOptions-polygon-marker-states-select.name: plotOptions-polygon-marker-states-select--lineColor
plotOptions-polygon-marker-states-select.title: lineColor
plotOptions-polygon-marker-states-select.description: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

plotOptions-pie--enableMouseTracking.name: plotOptions-pie--enableMouseTracking
plotOptions-pie--enableMouseTracking.title: enableMouseTracking
plotOptions-pie--enableMouseTracking.description: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance.

plotOptions-polygon--negativeColor.name: plotOptions-polygon--negativeColor
plotOptions-polygon--negativeColor.title: negativeColor
plotOptions-polygon--negativeColor.description: The color for the parts of the graph or points that are below the threshold.

plotOptions-solidgauge-zones--color.name: plotOptions-solidgauge-zones--color
plotOptions-solidgauge-zones--color.title: color
plotOptions-solidgauge-zones--color.description: Defines the color of the series.

plotOptions-bar-tooltip--valueSuffix.name: plotOptions-bar-tooltip--valueSuffix
plotOptions-bar-tooltip--valueSuffix.title: valueSuffix
plotOptions-bar-tooltip--valueSuffix.description: A string to append to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

plotOptions-columnrange-dataLabels--shap.name: plotOptions-columnrange-dataLabels--shape
plotOptions-columnrange-dataLabels--shap.title: shape
plotOptions-columnrange-dataLabels--shap.description: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the label. Symbols are predefined functions on the Renderer object.

plotOptions-treemap-dataLabels--useHTML.name: plotOptions-treemap-dataLabels--useHTML
plotOptions-treemap-dataLabels--useHTML.title: useHTML
plotOptions-treemap-dataLabels--useHTML.description: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

plotOptions-arearange-tooltip--followPoi.name: plotOptions-arearange-tooltip--followPointer
plotOptions-arearange-tooltip--followPoi.title: followPointer
plotOptions-arearange-tooltip--followPoi.description:
Whether the tooltip should follow the mouse as it moves across columns, pie slices and other point types with an extent. By default it behaves this way for scatter, bubble and pie series by override in the plotOptions for those series types.

For touch moves to behave the same way, followTouchMove must be true also.

plotOptions-errorbar--stemWidth.name: plotOptions-errorbar--stemWidth
plotOptions-errorbar--stemWidth.title: stemWidth
plotOptions-errorbar--stemWidth.description: The width of the stem, the vertical line extending from the box to the whiskers. If null, the width is inherited from the lineWidth option.

plotOptions-waterfall-dataLabels--defer.name: plotOptions-waterfall-dataLabels--defer
plotOptions-waterfall-dataLabels--defer.title: defer
plotOptions-waterfall-dataLabels--defer.description: Whether to defer displaying the data labels until the initial series animation has finished.

plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--borderWidth
plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--.title: borderWidth
plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--.description: The border width in pixels for the data label.

plotOptions-waterfall-states-hover-marke.name: plotOptions-waterfall-states-hover-marker--radius
plotOptions-waterfall-states-hover-marke.title: radius
plotOptions-waterfall-states-hover-marke.description: The radius of the point marker.

plotOptions-treemap-dataLabels--rotation.name: plotOptions-treemap-dataLabels--rotation
plotOptions-treemap-dataLabels--rotation.title: rotation
plotOptions-treemap-dataLabels--rotation.description: Text rotation in degrees. Note that due to a more complex structure, backgrounds, borders and padding will be lost on a rotated data label.

plotOptions-treemap-zones--dashStyle.name: plotOptions-treemap-zones--dashStyle
plotOptions-treemap-zones--dashStyle.title: dashStyle
plotOptions-treemap-zones--dashStyle.description: A name for the dash style to use for the graph.

plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--format
plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--.title: format
plotOptions-areasplinerange-dataLabels--.description: A format string for the data label. Available variables are the same as for formatter.

navigation-buttonOptions--verticalAlign.name: navigation-buttonOptions--verticalAlign
navigation-buttonOptions--verticalAlign.title: verticalAlign
navigation-buttonOptions--verticalAlign.description: The vertical alignment of the buttons. Can be one of "top", "middle" or "bottom".

plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--paddin.name: plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--padding
plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--paddin.title: padding
plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--paddin.description: When either the borderWidth or the backgroundColor is set, this is the padding within the box.

plotOptions-heatmap-states-hover-marker-.name: plotOptions-heatmap-states-hover-marker--height
plotOptions-heatmap-states-hover-marker-.title: height
plotOptions-heatmap-states-hover-marker-.description: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a width must also be set.

plotOptions-column--animation.name: plotOptions-column--animation
plotOptions-column--animation.title: animation
plotOptions-column--animation.description:
Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. The animation can also be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods. The following properties are supported:

duration
The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
easing
When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooTools as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing.

Due to poor performance, animation is disabled in old IE browsers for column charts and polar charts.

plotOptions-spline-marker-states-hover--.name: plotOptions-spline-marker-states-hover--radiusPlus
plotOptions-spline-marker-states-hover--.title: radiusPlus
plotOptions-spline-marker-states-hover--.description: The number of pixels to increase the radius of the hovered point.

plotOptions-bubble-marker-states-hover--.name: plotOptions-bubble-marker-states-hover--lineWidth
plotOptions-bubble-marker-states-hover--.title: lineWidth
plotOptions-bubble-marker-states-hover--.description: The width of the point marker's outline.

plotOptions-bar--stacking.name: plotOptions-bar--stacking
plotOptions-bar--stacking.title: stacking
plotOptions-bar--stacking.description: Whether to stack the values of each series on top of each other. Possible values are null to disable, "normal" to stack by value or "percent".

plotOptions-treemap--linkedTo.name: plotOptions-treemap--linkedTo
plotOptions-treemap--linkedTo.title: linkedTo
plotOptions-treemap--linkedTo.description: The id of another series to link to. Additionally, the value can be ":previous" to link to the previous series. When two series are linked, only the first one appears in the legend. Toggling the visibility of this also toggles the linked series.

xAxis--lineColor.name: xAxis--lineColor
xAxis--lineColor.title: lineColor
xAxis--lineColor.description: The color of the line marking the axis itself.

plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-mar.name: plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-marker--fillColor
plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-mar.title: fillColor
plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-mar.description: The fill color of the point marker. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

yAxis-title--align.name: yAxis-title--align
yAxis-title--align.title: align
yAxis-title--align.description:
Alignment of the title relative to the axis values. Possible values
 are "low", "middle" or "high".

plotOptions-errorbar--pointInterval.name: plotOptions-errorbar--pointInterval
plotOptions-errorbar--pointInterval.title: pointInterval
plotOptions-errorbar--pointInterval.description:
If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointInterval defines the interval of the x values. For example, if a series contains one value every decade starting from year 0, set pointInterval to 10.

Since Highcharts 4.1, it can be combined with pointIntervalUnit to draw irregular intervals.

plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-hal.name: plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-halo--attributes
plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-hal.title: attributes
plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-hal.description: A collection of SVG attributes to override the appearance of the halo, for example fill, stroke and stroke-width.

plotOptions-funnel-tooltip--shape.name: plotOptions-funnel-tooltip--shape
plotOptions-funnel-tooltip--shape.title: shape
plotOptions-funnel-tooltip--shape.description: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the tooltip. In Highcharts 3.x and less, the shape was square.

plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--dat.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--dateTimeLabelFormats
plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--dat.title: dateTimeLabelFormats
plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--dat.description:
For series on a datetime axes, the date format in the tooltip's header will by default be guessed based on the closest data points. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.

Defaults to: 

{
    millisecond:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S.%L",
    second:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S",
    minute:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M",
    hour:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M",
    day:"%A, %b %e, %Y",
    week:"Week from %A, %b %e, %Y",
    month:"%B %Y",
    year:"%Y"
}

plotOptions-column--cropThreshold.name: plotOptions-column--cropThreshold
plotOptions-column--cropThreshold.title: cropThreshold
plotOptions-column--cropThreshold.description: When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn,  event if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series.  .

plotOptions-spline--stacking.name: plotOptions-spline--stacking
plotOptions-spline--stacking.title: stacking
plotOptions-spline--stacking.description: Whether to stack the values of each series on top of each other. Possible values are null to disable, "normal" to stack by value or "percent".

global--timezoneOffset.name: global--timezoneOffset
global--timezoneOffset.title: timezoneOffset
global--timezoneOffset.description: The timezone offset in minutes. Positive values are west, negative values are east of UTC, as in the ECMAScript getTimezoneOffset method. Use this to display UTC based data in a predefined time zone.

plotOptions-solidgauge-dataLabels--enabl.name: plotOptions-solidgauge-dataLabels--enabled
plotOptions-solidgauge-dataLabels--enabl.title: enabled
plotOptions-solidgauge-dataLabels--enabl.description: Enable or disable the data labels.

plotOptions-spline-zones--value.name: plotOptions-spline-zones--value
plotOptions-spline-zones--value.title: value
plotOptions-spline-zones--value.description: The value up to where the zone extends, if undefined the zones stretches to the last value in the series.

plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--overfl.name: plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--overflow
plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--overfl.title: overflow
plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--overfl.description: How to handle data labels that flow outside the plot area. The default is justify, which aligns them inside the plot area. For columns and bars, this means it will be moved inside the bar. To display data labels outside the plot area, set crop to false and overflow to "none".

plotOptions-bubble-dataLabels--shadow.name: plotOptions-bubble-dataLabels--shadow
plotOptions-bubble-dataLabels--shadow.title: shadow
plotOptions-bubble-dataLabels--shadow.description: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

plotOptions-area--negativeFillColor.name: plotOptions-area--negativeFillColor
plotOptions-area--negativeFillColor.title: negativeFillColor
plotOptions-area--negativeFillColor.description: A separate color for the negative part of the area.

plotOptions-bubble-marker-states-hover--.name: plotOptions-bubble-marker-states-hover--fillColor
plotOptions-bubble-marker-states-hover--.title: fillColor
plotOptions-bubble-marker-states-hover--.description: The fill color of the marker in hover state.

plotOptions-heatmap-states-hover-marker-.name: plotOptions-heatmap-states-hover-marker--radius
plotOptions-heatmap-states-hover-marker-.title: radius
plotOptions-heatmap-states-hover-marker-.description: The radius of the point marker.

plotOptions-funnel-tooltip--headerFormat.name: plotOptions-funnel-tooltip--headerFormat
plotOptions-funnel-tooltip--headerFormat.title: headerFormat
plotOptions-funnel-tooltip--headerFormat.description:
The HTML of the tooltip header line. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.key, series.name, series.color and other members from the point and series objects. The point.key variable contains the category name, x value or datetime string depending on the type of axis. For datetime axes, the point.key date format can be set using tooltip.xDateFormat.

Defaults to <span style="font-size: 10px">{point.key}</span><br/>

plotOptions-bar-states-hover-marker--fil.name: plotOptions-bar-states-hover-marker--fillColor
plotOptions-bar-states-hover-marker--fil.title: fillColor
plotOptions-bar-states-hover-marker--fil.description: The fill color of the point marker. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

plotOptions-bubble--stickyTracking.name: plotOptions-bubble--stickyTracking
plotOptions-bubble--stickyTracking.title: stickyTracking
plotOptions-bubble--stickyTracking.description: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series.

plotOptions-polygon-tooltip--footerForma.name: plotOptions-polygon-tooltip--footerFormat
plotOptions-polygon-tooltip--footerForma.title: footerFormat
plotOptions-polygon-tooltip--footerForma.description: A string to append to the tooltip format.

plotOptions-pie--selected.name: plotOptions-pie--selected
plotOptions-pie--selected.title: selected
plotOptions-pie--selected.description: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series.

plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--borderWi.name: plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--borderWidth
plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--borderWi.title: borderWidth
plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--borderWi.description: The border width in pixels for the data label.

plotOptions-areaspline--cursor.name: plotOptions-areaspline--cursor
plotOptions-areaspline--cursor.title: cursor
plotOptions-areaspline--cursor.description: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to  the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked.

plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--fol.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--followTouchMove
plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--fol.title: followTouchMove
plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--fol.description: Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove.

plotOptions-bar--allowPointSelect.name: plotOptions-bar--allowPointSelect
plotOptions-bar--allowPointSelect.title: allowPointSelect
plotOptions-bar--allowPointSelect.description: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices.

plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover-marker--radius
plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover.title: radius
plotOptions-areasplinerange-states-hover.description: The radius of the point marker.

legend--margin.name: legend--margin
legend--margin.title: margin
legend--margin.description: If the plot area sized is calculated automatically and the legend is not floating, the legend margin is the  space between the legend and the axis labels or plot area.

plotOptions-areaspline-tooltip--shape.name: plotOptions-areaspline-tooltip--shape
plotOptions-areaspline-tooltip--shape.title: shape
plotOptions-areaspline-tooltip--shape.description: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the tooltip. In Highcharts 3.x and less, the shape was square.

plotOptions-treemap-dataLabels--align.name: plotOptions-treemap-dataLabels--align
plotOptions-treemap-dataLabels--align.title: align
plotOptions-treemap-dataLabels--align.description: The alignment of the data label compared to the point. If right, the right side of the label should be touching the point. For points with an extent, like columns, the alignments also dictates how to align it inside the box, as given with the inside option. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right".

plotOptions-solidgauge-tooltip--pointFor.name: plotOptions-solidgauge-tooltip--pointFormat
plotOptions-solidgauge-tooltip--pointFor.title: pointFormat
plotOptions-solidgauge-tooltip--pointFor.description: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.yPrefix and tooltip.ySuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units.

plotOptions-bar-dataLabels--zIndex.name: plotOptions-bar-dataLabels--zIndex
plotOptions-bar-dataLabels--zIndex.title: zIndex
plotOptions-bar-dataLabels--zIndex.description: The Z index of the data labels. The default Z index puts it above the series. Use a Z index of 2 to display it behind the series.

plotOptions-boxplot--colors.name: plotOptions-boxplot--colors
plotOptions-boxplot--colors.title: colors
plotOptions-boxplot--colors.description: A series specific or series type specific color set to apply instead of the global colors when colorByPoint is true.

plotOptions-arearange--shadow.name: plotOptions-arearange--shadow
plotOptions-arearange--shadow.title: shadow
plotOptions-arearange--shadow.description: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

plotOptions-waterfall-tooltip--shape.name: plotOptions-waterfall-tooltip--shape
plotOptions-waterfall-tooltip--shape.title: shape
plotOptions-waterfall-tooltip--shape.description: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the tooltip. In Highcharts 3.x and less, the shape was square.

plotOptions-area--step.name: plotOptions-area--step
plotOptions-area--step.title: step
plotOptions-area--step.description: Whether to apply steps to the line. Possible values are left, center and right. Prior to 2.3.5, only left was supported.

plotOptions-boxplot--turboThreshold.name: plotOptions-boxplot--turboThreshold
plotOptions-boxplot--turboThreshold.title: turboThreshold
plotOptions-boxplot--turboThreshold.description: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Set it to 0 disable.

chart--plotBackgroundImage.name: chart--plotBackgroundImage
chart--plotBackgroundImage.title: plotBackgroundImage
chart--plotBackgroundImage.description: The URL for an image to use as the plot background. To set an image as the background for the entire chart, set a CSS background image to the container element. Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.

plotOptions-column--showCheckbox.name: plotOptions-column--showCheckbox
plotOptions-column--showCheckbox.title: showCheckbox
plotOptions-column--showCheckbox.description: If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option.

tooltip--shape.name: tooltip--shape
tooltip--shape.title: shape
tooltip--shape.description: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the tooltip. In Highcharts 3.x and less, the shape was square.

plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--overflow.name: plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--overflow
plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--overflow.title: overflow
plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--overflow.description: How to handle data labels that flow outside the plot area. The default is justify, which aligns them inside the plot area. For columns and bars, this means it will be moved inside the bar. To display data labels outside the plot area, set crop to false and overflow to "none".

yAxis--showLastLabel.name: yAxis--showLastLabel
yAxis--showLastLabel.title: showLastLabel
yAxis--showLastLabel.description: Whether to show the last tick label.

exporting-buttons-contextButton--menuIte.name: exporting-buttons-contextButton--menuItems
exporting-buttons-contextButton--menuIte.title: menuItems
exporting-buttons-contextButton--menuIte.description:
A collection of config options for the menu items. Each options object consists of a text option which is a string to show in the menu item, as well as an onclick parameter which is a callback function to run on click.

By default, there is the "Print" menu item plus one menu item for each of the available export types. Menu items can be customized by defining a new array of items and assigning null to unwanted positions (see override example below).

plotOptions-columnrange--zoneAxis.name: plotOptions-columnrange--zoneAxis
plotOptions-columnrange--zoneAxis.title: zoneAxis
plotOptions-columnrange--zoneAxis.description: Defines the Axis on which the zones are applied.

plotOptions-arearange-tooltip--valuePref.name: plotOptions-arearange-tooltip--valuePrefix
plotOptions-arearange-tooltip--valuePref.title: valuePrefix
plotOptions-arearange-tooltip--valuePref.description: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

plotOptions-funnel-states-hover-marker--.name: plotOptions-funnel-states-hover-marker--fillColor
plotOptions-funnel-states-hover-marker--.title: fillColor
plotOptions-funnel-states-hover-marker--.description: The fill color of the point marker. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

plotOptions-areaspline-dataLabels--color.name: plotOptions-areaspline-dataLabels--color
plotOptions-areaspline-dataLabels--color.title: color
plotOptions-areaspline-dataLabels--color.description: The text color for the data labels. Defaults to null.

plotOptions-funnel-states-hover-marker--.name: plotOptions-funnel-states-hover-marker--lineColor
plotOptions-funnel-states-hover-marker--.title: lineColor
plotOptions-funnel-states-hover-marker--.description: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

plotOptions-waterfall-tooltip--followPoi.name: plotOptions-waterfall-tooltip--followPointer
plotOptions-waterfall-tooltip--followPoi.title: followPointer
plotOptions-waterfall-tooltip--followPoi.description:
Whether the tooltip should follow the mouse as it moves across columns, pie slices and other point types with an extent. By default it behaves this way for scatter, bubble and pie series by override in the plotOptions for those series types.

For touch moves to behave the same way, followTouchMove must be true also.

plotOptions-heatmap-tooltip--followPoint.name: plotOptions-heatmap-tooltip--followPointer
plotOptions-heatmap-tooltip--followPoint.title: followPointer
plotOptions-heatmap-tooltip--followPoint.description:
Whether the tooltip should follow the mouse as it moves across columns, pie slices and other point types with an extent. By default it behaves this way for scatter, bubble and pie series by override in the plotOptions for those series types.

For touch moves to behave the same way, followTouchMove must be true also.

plotOptions-boxplot-states-hover-marker-.name: plotOptions-boxplot-states-hover-marker--lineWidth
plotOptions-boxplot-states-hover-marker-.title: lineWidth
plotOptions-boxplot-states-hover-marker-.description: The width of the point marker's outline.

plotOptions-spline-dataLabels--format.name: plotOptions-spline-dataLabels--format
plotOptions-spline-dataLabels--format.title: format
plotOptions-spline-dataLabels--format.description: A format string for the data label. Available variables are the same as for formatter.

plotOptions-pie--allowPointSelect.name: plotOptions-pie--allowPointSelect
plotOptions-pie--allowPointSelect.title: allowPointSelect
plotOptions-pie--allowPointSelect.description: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices.

chart--animation.name: chart--animation
chart--animation.title: animation
chart--animation.description:
Set the overall animation for all chart updating. Animation can be disabled throughout the chart by setting it to false here. It can be overridden for each individual API method as a function parameter. The only animation not affected by this option is the initial series animation, see plotOptions.series.animation.

The animation can either be set as a boolean or a configuration object. If true, it will use the 'swing' jQuery easing and a duration of 500 ms. If used as a configuration object, the following properties are supported:

duration
The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
easing
When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooTools as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing.

plotOptions-column--colors.name: plotOptions-column--colors
plotOptions-column--colors.title: colors
plotOptions-column--colors.description: A series specific or series type specific color set to apply instead of the global colors when colorByPoint is true.

yAxis-stackLabels--enabled.name: yAxis-stackLabels--enabled
yAxis-stackLabels--enabled.title: enabled
yAxis-stackLabels--enabled.description: Enable or disable the stack total labels.

plotOptions-scatter--pointIntervalUnit.name: plotOptions-scatter--pointIntervalUnit
plotOptions-scatter--pointIntervalUnit.title: pointIntervalUnit
plotOptions-scatter--pointIntervalUnit.description: On datetime series, this allows for setting the pointInterval to the two irregular time units, month and year. Combine it with pointInterval to draw quarters, 6 months, 10 years etc.

plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--hid.name: plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--hideDelay
plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--hid.title: hideDelay
plotOptions-areasplinerange-tooltip--hid.description: The number of milliseconds to wait until the tooltip is hidden when mouse out from a point or chart.

plotOptions-pie-zones--value.name: plotOptions-pie-zones--value
plotOptions-pie-zones--value.title: value
plotOptions-pie-zones--value.description: The value up to where the zone extends, if undefined the zones stretches to the last value in the series.

plotOptions-area--shadow.name: plotOptions-area--shadow
plotOptions-area--shadow.title: shadow
plotOptions-area--shadow.description: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

plotOptions-area--stickyTracking.name: plotOptions-area--stickyTracking
plotOptions-area--stickyTracking.title: stickyTracking
plotOptions-area--stickyTracking.description: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true for line and area type series, but to false for columns, pies etc.

plotOptions-polygon-states-hover-marker-.name: plotOptions-polygon-states-hover-marker--lineColor
plotOptions-polygon-states-hover-marker-.title: lineColor
plotOptions-polygon-states-hover-marker-.description: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

plotOptions-polygon-zones--color.name: plotOptions-polygon-zones--color
plotOptions-polygon-zones--color.title: color
plotOptions-polygon-zones--color.description: Defines the color of the series.

plotOptions-areaspline-dataLabels--paddi.name: plotOptions-areaspline-dataLabels--padding
plotOptions-areaspline-dataLabels--paddi.title: padding
plotOptions-areaspline-dataLabels--paddi.description: When either the borderWidth or the backgroundColor is set, this is the padding within the box.

plotOptions-column-dataLabels--align.name: plotOptions-column-dataLabels--align
plotOptions-column-dataLabels--align.title: align
plotOptions-column-dataLabels--align.description: The alignment of the data label compared to the point. If right, the right side of the label should be touching the point. For points with an extent, like columns, the alignments also dictates how to align it inside the box, as given with the inside option. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right".

plotOptions-gauge--stickyTracking.name: plotOptions-gauge--stickyTracking
plotOptions-gauge--stickyTracking.title: stickyTracking
plotOptions-gauge--stickyTracking.description: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true for line and area type series, but to false for columns, pies etc.

plotOptions-waterfall-dataLabels--border.name: plotOptions-waterfall-dataLabels--borderWidth
plotOptions-waterfall-dataLabels--border.title: borderWidth
plotOptions-waterfall-dataLabels--border.description: The border width in pixels for the data label.

exporting-buttons-contextButton--theme.name: exporting-buttons-contextButton--theme
exporting-buttons-contextButton--theme.title: theme
exporting-buttons-contextButton--theme.description: A configuration object for the button theme. The object accepts SVG properties like stroke-width, stroke and fill. Tri-state button styles are supported by the states.hover and states.select objects.

plotOptions-solidgauge-dataLabels--shado.name: plotOptions-solidgauge-dataLabels--shadow
plotOptions-solidgauge-dataLabels--shado.title: shadow
plotOptions-solidgauge-dataLabels--shado.description: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

legend--itemMarginTop.name: legend--itemMarginTop
legend--itemMarginTop.title: itemMarginTop
legend--itemMarginTop.description: The pixel top margin for each legend item.

plotOptions-scatter--turboThreshold.name: plotOptions-scatter--turboThreshold
plotOptions-scatter--turboThreshold.title: turboThreshold
plotOptions-scatter--turboThreshold.description: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Set it to 0 disable.

plotOptions-bubble--selected.name: plotOptions-bubble--selected
plotOptions-bubble--selected.title: selected
plotOptions-bubble--selected.description: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series.

plotOptions-bubble--pointIntervalUnit.name: plotOptions-bubble--pointIntervalUnit
plotOptions-bubble--pointIntervalUnit.title: pointIntervalUnit
plotOptions-bubble--pointIntervalUnit.description: On datetime series, this allows for setting the pointInterval to the two irregular time units, month and year. Combine it with pointInterval to draw quarters, 6 months, 10 years etc.

plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-hal.name: plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-halo--size
plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-hal.title: size
plotOptions-columnrange-states-hover-hal.description: The pixel size of the halo. For point markers this is the radius of the halo. For pie slices it is the width of the halo outside the slice. For bubbles it defaults to 5 and is the width of the halo outside the bubble.

plotOptions-gauge-states-hover-halo--att.name: plotOptions-gauge-states-hover-halo--attributes
plotOptions-gauge-states-hover-halo--att.title: attributes
plotOptions-gauge-states-hover-halo--att.description: A collection of SVG attributes to override the appearance of the halo, for example fill, stroke and stroke-width.

plotOptions-scatter--visible.name: plotOptions-scatter--visible
plotOptions-scatter--visible.title: visible
plotOptions-scatter--visible.description: Set the initial visibility of the series.

data--googleSpreadsheetKey.name: data--googleSpreadsheetKey
data--googleSpreadsheetKey.title: googleSpreadsheetKey
data--googleSpreadsheetKey.description: The key for a Google Spreadsheet to load. See general information on GS.

plotOptions-arearange-states-hover-halo-.name: plotOptions-arearange-states-hover-halo--opacity
plotOptions-arearange-states-hover-halo-.title: opacity
plotOptions-arearange-states-hover-halo-.description: Opacity for the halo unless a specific fill is overridden using the attributes setting. Note that Highcharts is only able to apply opacity to colors of hex or rgb(a) formats.

plotOptions-gauge-states-hover-marker--s.name: plotOptions-gauge-states-hover-marker--symbol
plotOptions-gauge-states-hover-marker--s.title: symbol
plotOptions-gauge-states-hover-marker--s.description:
A predefined shape or symbol for the marker. When null, the symbol is pulled from options.symbols. Other possible values are "circle", "square", "diamond", "triangle" and "triangle-down".

Additionally, the URL to a graphic can be given on this form: "url(graphic.png)". Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.

Custom callbacks for symbol path generation can also be added to Highcharts.SVGRenderer.prototype.symbols. The callback is then used by its method name, as shown in the demo.

legend--itemHoverStyle.name: legend--itemHoverStyle
legend--itemHoverStyle.title: itemHoverStyle

plotOptions-column-tooltip--followTouchM.name: plotOptions-column-tooltip--followTouchMove
plotOptions-column-tooltip--followTouchM.title: followTouchMove
plotOptions-column-tooltip--followTouchM.description: Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove.

plotOptions-bubble--threshold.name: plotOptions-bubble--threshold
plotOptions-bubble--threshold.title: threshold
plotOptions-bubble--threshold.description: The threshold, also called zero level or base level. For line type series this is only used in conjunction with negativeColor.

plotOptions-polygon-states-hover-halo--o.name: plotOptions-polygon-states-hover-halo--opacity
plotOptions-polygon-states-hover-halo--o.title: opacity
plotOptions-polygon-states-hover-halo--o.description: Opacity for the halo unless a specific fill is overridden using the attributes setting. Note that Highcharts is only able to apply opacity to colors of hex or rgb(a) formats.

plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--softConn.name: plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--softConnector
plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--softConn.title: softConnector
plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--softConn.description: Whether to render the connector as a soft arc or a line with sharp break.

plotOptions-bubble--visible.name: plotOptions-bubble--visible
plotOptions-bubble--visible.title: visible
plotOptions-bubble--visible.description: Set the initial visibility of the series.

xAxis-title--margin.name: xAxis-title--margin
xAxis-title--margin.title: margin
xAxis-title--margin.description: The pixel distance between the axis labels or line and the title. Defaults to 0 for horizontal axes, 10 for vertical

plotOptions-polygon-marker-states-select.name: plotOptions-polygon-marker-states-select--radius
plotOptions-polygon-marker-states-select.title: radius
plotOptions-polygon-marker-states-select.description:
The radius of the point marker. In hover state, it defaults
		to the normal state's radius + 2.

plotOptions-bar--cursor.name: plotOptions-bar--cursor
plotOptions-bar--cursor.title: cursor
plotOptions-bar--cursor.description: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to  the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked.

plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--padding.name: plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--padding
plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--padding.title: padding
plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--padding.description: When either the borderWidth or the backgroundColor is set, this is the padding within the box.

plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--color.name: plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--color
plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--color.title: color
plotOptions-funnel-dataLabels--color.description: The text color for the data labels. Defaults to null.

plotOptions-funnel-states-hover-halo--op.name: plotOptions-funnel-states-hover-halo--opacity
plotOptions-funnel-states-hover-halo--op.title: opacity
plotOptions-funnel-states-hover-halo--op.description: Opacity for the halo unless a specific fill is overridden using the attributes setting. Note that Highcharts is only able to apply opacity to colors of hex or rgb(a) formats.

plotOptions-pyramid--borderColor.name: plotOptions-pyramid--borderColor
plotOptions-pyramid--borderColor.title: borderColor
plotOptions-pyramid--borderColor.description: The color of the border surrounding each slice.

plotOptions-areaspline-marker-states-sel.name: plotOptions-areaspline-marker-states-select--fillColor
plotOptions-areaspline-marker-states-sel.title: fillColor
plotOptions-areaspline-marker-states-sel.description: The fill color of the point marker.

xAxis--gridLineColor.name: xAxis--gridLineColor
xAxis--gridLineColor.title: gridLineColor
xAxis--gridLineColor.description: Color of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area.

plotOptions-column--linkedTo.name: plotOptions-column--linkedTo
plotOptions-column--linkedTo.title: linkedTo
plotOptions-column--linkedTo.description: The id of another series to link to. Additionally, the value can be ":previous" to link to the previous series. When two series are linked, only the first one appears in the legend. Toggling the visibility of this also toggles the linked series.

plotOptions-gauge-pivot--borderColor.name: plotOptions-gauge-pivot--borderColor
plotOptions-gauge-pivot--borderColor.title: borderColor
plotOptions-gauge-pivot--borderColor.description: The border or stroke color of the pivot. In able to change this, the borderWidth must also be set to something other than the default 0.

plotOptions-spline-marker--lineWidth.name: plotOptions-spline-marker--lineWidth
plotOptions-spline-marker--lineWidth.title: lineWidth
plotOptions-spline-marker--lineWidth.description: The width of the point marker's outline.

plotOptions-areaspline--trackByArea.name: plotOptions-areaspline--trackByArea
plotOptions-areaspline--trackByArea.title: trackByArea
plotOptions-areaspline--trackByArea.description: Whether the whole area or just the line should respond to mouseover tooltips and other mouse or touch events.

plotOptions-spline--cursor.name: plotOptions-spline--cursor
plotOptions-spline--cursor.title: cursor
plotOptions-spline--cursor.description: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to  the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked.

plotOptions-funnel--borderColor.name: plotOptions-funnel--borderColor
plotOptions-funnel--borderColor.title: borderColor
plotOptions-funnel--borderColor.description: The color of the border surrounding each slice.

plotOptions-pyramid--showInLegend.name: plotOptions-pyramid--showInLegend
plotOptions-pyramid--showInLegend.title: showInLegend
plotOptions-pyramid--showInLegend.description: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. Since 2.1, pies are not shown in the legend by default.

plotOptions-bar--pointRange.name: plotOptions-bar--pointRange
plotOptions-bar--pointRange.title: pointRange
plotOptions-bar--pointRange.description: The X axis range that each point is valid for. This determines the width of the column. On a categorized axis, the range will be 1 by default (one category unit). On linear and datetime axes, the range will be computed as the distance between the two closest data points.

plotOptions-errorbar-states-hover--lineW.name: plotOptions-errorbar-states-hover--lineWidthPlus
plotOptions-errorbar-states-hover--lineW.title: lineWidthPlus
plotOptions-errorbar-states-hover--lineW.description: The additional line width for the graph of a hovered series.

plotOptions-polygon--dashStyle.name: plotOptions-polygon--dashStyle
plotOptions-polygon--dashStyle.title: dashStyle
plotOptions-polygon--dashStyle.description:
A name for the dash style to use for the graph. Applies only to series type having a graph, like line, spline, area and scatter in case it has a lineWidth. The value for the dashStyle include:
  • Solid
  • ShortDash
  • ShortDot
  • ShortDashDot
  • ShortDashDotDot
  • Dot
  • Dash
  • LongDash
  • DashDot
  • LongDashDot
  • LongDashDotDot

plotOptions-gauge-states-hover-marker--e.name: plotOptions-gauge-states-hover-marker--enabled
plotOptions-gauge-states-hover-marker--e.title: enabled
plotOptions-gauge-states-hover-marker--e.description: Enable or disable the point marker.

plotOptions-areaspline-marker--height.name: plotOptions-areaspline-marker--height
plotOptions-areaspline-marker--height.title: height
plotOptions-areaspline-marker--height.description: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a width must also be set.

plotOptions-columnrange--turboThreshold.name: plotOptions-columnrange--turboThreshold
plotOptions-columnrange--turboThreshold.title: turboThreshold
plotOptions-columnrange--turboThreshold.description: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Set it to 0 disable.

data--startColumn.name: data--startColumn
data--startColumn.title: startColumn
data--startColumn.description: In tabular input data, the first column (indexed by 0) to use.

plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--shadow.name: plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--shadow
plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--shadow.title: shadow
plotOptions-scatter-dataLabels--shadow.description: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

plotOptions-area--dashStyle.name: plotOptions-area--dashStyle
plotOptions-area--dashStyle.title: dashStyle
plotOptions-area--dashStyle.description:
A name for the dash style to use for the graph. Applies only to series type having a graph, like line, spline, area and scatter in case it has a lineWidth. The value for the dashStyle include:
  • Solid
  • ShortDash
  • ShortDot
  • ShortDashDot
  • ShortDashDotDot
  • Dot
  • Dash
  • LongDash
  • DashDot
  • LongDashDot
  • LongDashDotDot

plotOptions-column--enableMouseTracking.name: plotOptions-column--enableMouseTracking
plotOptions-column--enableMouseTracking.title: enableMouseTracking
plotOptions-column--enableMouseTracking.description: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance.

plotOptions-solidgauge-dataLabels--paddi.name: plotOptions-solidgauge-dataLabels--padding
plotOptions-solidgauge-dataLabels--paddi.title: padding
plotOptions-solidgauge-dataLabels--paddi.description: When either the borderWidth or the backgroundColor is set, this is the padding within the box.

plotOptions-bubble--showCheckbox.name: plotOptions-bubble--showCheckbox
plotOptions-bubble--showCheckbox.title: showCheckbox
plotOptions-bubble--showCheckbox.description: If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option.

chart--panKey.name: chart--panKey
chart--panKey.title: panKey
chart--panKey.description: Allows setting a key to switch between zooming and panning.

plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--connecto.name: plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--connectorPadding
plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--connecto.title: connectorPadding
plotOptions-pyramid-dataLabels--connecto.description: The distance from the data label to the connector.

yAxis-labels--autoRotation.name: yAxis-labels--autoRotation
yAxis-labels--autoRotation.title: autoRotation
yAxis-labels--autoRotation.description: For horizontal axes, the allowed degrees of label rotation to prevent overlapping labels. If there is enough space, labels are not rotated. As the chart gets narrower, it will start rotating the labels -45 degrees, then remove every second label and try again with rotations 0 and -45 etc. Set it to false to disable rotation, which will cause the labels to word-wrap if possible.

plotOptions-areaspline--lineColor.name: plotOptions-areaspline--lineColor
plotOptions-areaspline--lineColor.title: lineColor
plotOptions-areaspline--lineColor.description: A separate color for the graph line. By default the line takes the color of the series, but the lineColor setting allows setting a separate color for the line without altering the fillColor.
